#### Workflow Enhancements

# Workflow Enhancements

Explore the new capabilities and enhancements introduced in this release, which enhance workflow efficiencies.

# Copy Design - Property Editing

Unlock a more intelligent and streamlined design workflow with the Vault 2026.1 Update. This enhanced Copy Design feature now empowers users to edit key properties during the copying process, thereby eliminating the risk of missed updates and conserving valuable time. Whether one is duplicating a drawing, a complete design structure, or individual components, it is now possible to modify multiple properties simultaneously, utilizing intuitive copy/paste functionality or directly from Excel. Initiate your next design with confidence, precision, and efficiency right from the moment of copying.

![](../images/new-2026-1-copydesign-propertyedit.png)

For more information, see [Copy Design - Main View Grid](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-9865E786-4FE2-40AC-B951-1FEBA910ECCC#main-view)

Feature was inspired by suggestions from the [Vault Community Idea Board](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/edit-properties-during-a-copy-design/idi-p/9644866).

# Copy Design – Numbering Scheme

Eliminate Renaming Headaches with Default Numbering Distribution

Vault 2026.1 streamlines the Copy Design process by enabling administrators to establish and disseminate a default numbering scheme for all users. This improvement guarantees consistency from the outset, thus averting expensive renaming tasks and diminishing errors that may arise from improper numbering or naming conventions. By standardizing the nomenclature of new designs, teams conserve time, remain aligned with corporate standards, and ensure that projects progress without disruption.

![](../images/new-2026-1-copydesign-numberscheme.png)

For more information, see [Copy Design - Select Numbering Scheme](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-54272FDF-E145-4972-A900-2E197F8F9E71)

# Update Properties Enhancement

Vault 2026.1 eliminates the inconvenience associated with manual property updates through the introduction of a new, intelligent prompt during file check-out from the Vault client. When users initiate the check-out of a file within the Vault client, they are promptly reminded to update the mapped properties, thereby ensuring data synchronization without necessitating additional steps. This straightforward automation mitigates errors, conserves time, and maintains alignment between designs and Vault data. Though it represents a minor alteration, it possesses a substantial effect on overall productivity.

![](../images/new-2026-1-update-properties.png)

Feature was inspired by suggestions from the [Vault Community Idea Board](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/vault-open-gt-update-properties/idi-p/5319005).

# Batch Plot Enhancement

Batch Plot Smarter - From 40 Clicks to Just 3

Vault 2026.1 brings a revolutionary advancement to batch plotting through a markedly simplified workflow. Instead of navigating through a cumbersome process involving 40 manual clicks, users are now able to generate comprehensive drawing lists in merely three clicks by utilizing the new “Plot Related Design Representation Files” command. By selecting the top-level assembly, Vault systematically compiles all pertinent design representation files, which are then prepared for batch plotting. This enhancement not only saves time but also diminishes errors, thereby allowing your teams to concentrate on design rather than file preparation.

![](../images/new-2026-1-batchplot.png)

For more information, see [Access the Plot Manager](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-FF4AA0DF-661B-4381-8E03-E4EDA8F2EB77)

Feature was inspired by suggestions from the [Vault Community Idea Board](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/drawing-lists-and-batch-plotting/idi-p/7704375).

# Layout View Enhancement

Bigger Thumbnails, Faster Decisions

Vault 2026.1 enhances the viewing experience by introducing resizable thumbnails in the Vault grid, allowing for easier differentiation between similar models and drawings at a glance. Users are no longer required to open files individually to locate the correct one. This update substantially decreases the number of clicks necessary, streamlining workflow processes and increasing productivity. With improved visuals and reduced procedural steps, users will spend less time searching and more time focused on delivering results.

![](../images/new-2026-1-thumbnail.png)

Feature was inspired by suggestions from the [Vault Community Idea Board](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/thumbnail-preview-size-custom/idi-p/11833190).

# PDF Automatic Item Attachment

Vault 2026.1 significantly enhances operational efficiency through the automation of attaching 2D PDF files during the Assign/Update Item process. The previous manual steps and the possibility of overlooked files have been eliminated; PDFs are now seamlessly integrated with Items, akin to DWG and IDW representations. This improvement guarantees the inclusion of essential documentation, thereby mitigating the risk of oversight and expediting transitions to downstream teams. Stakeholders can now allocate less time to file management and focus more on design efforts.

For more information, see [Assign Items](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-8F7E1A77-FAAF-455E-A0BD-D64D7C4AD9F5)

Feature was inspired by suggestions from the [Vault Community Idea Board](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/ability-to-attach-pdf-files-on-item-creation/idi-p/6937566).

#### Connectivity Enhancements

# Connectivity Enhancements

Connect Vault to Fusion Manage Seamlessly and Efficiently with the new Vault Connector

# Vault Connector

Vault 2026.1 introduces the Vault Connector, a native, out-of-the-box (OOTB) connector that bridges the gap between design data management and process management systems. The Vault Connector is a powerful new integration that connects Autodesk Vault Professional (PDM) with Fusion Manage (PLM). This solution streamlines enterprise workflows by automating item and BOM synchronization, attaching neutral format files, and mapping attributes between systems. With built-in user notifications, configurable data flows, and support for multiple Vaults within a single Fusion Manage tenant, teams save hours of manual effort and avoid costly errors. From editing Items to creating BOMs, every step is faster, wiser, and fully connected.

![](../images/new-2026-1-vault-connector.png)

For more information about the Vault Connector, see [Vault Connector](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=VAULT-CONNECTOR-OVERVIEW). For frequently asked questions about the Vault Connector, see [Vault Connector FAQs](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=VAULT-CONNECTOR-FAQ).

**Parent page:** [2026.1 Updates and Enhancements](WN-2026-1-UPDATES.htm)

# Viewer Document Navigation

Navigate Multi-Sheet Drawings 30% Faster in the Vault Viewer.

This intuitive enhancement enhances productivity by up to 30%, allowing teams to review documentation more expeditiously and make informed decisions with assurance. # Thin Client Enhancements

Resize, Remember, and Review Faster in the Vault Thin Client

Vault 2026.1 presents a more innovative and efficient approach to managing file properties within the Thin Client environment. The introduction of a resizable property panel, accompanied by persistent panel settings, allows users to instantly view extended property values without the necessity to hover or scroll. This advancement not only conserves time but also mitigates frustration. Furthermore, enhanced caching substantially decreases load times when handling large assemblies, facilitating the revisitation of files without unnecessary waiting periods. The overall experience is quicker and more seamless, allowing users to concentrate on making decisions rather than encountering delays.

![](../images/new-2026-1-thinclient-property.png)

For more information, see [Thin Client - The Interface](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-755B8891-AA7F-489B-8770-168D39C4941D)

As an administrator, you can now set a "Disable On" date for user accounts. The account will be automatically disabled on the specified date based on the server date. [A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/expiry-dates-on-accounts/idi-p/6286494)

## Server Event Low Priority Mode for Property Compliance Check

The Low Priority Mode will be enabled during working hours by default. This mode now supports property compliance checks. Property compliance checks can be triggered by property definition changes during working hours.

The administrator can add their contact information in the newly introduced "Contact your Vault Administrator" field in vault server. The administrator contact information will be displayed to users, whose user account is disabled and when they try to login to server from Vault Client.

#### Trash Bin

# Trash Bin

As an administrator, you can now enable or disable the 'Trash Bin' feature. The Trash Bin feature in Vault Professional provides a secure way to manage deletion of entities such as files and folders. This feature is enabled by default and allows users to move entities to the Trash Bin instead of permanently deleting them. It minimizes the risk of accidental data loss and enhances usability by giving users greater control over file management.

### Who can enable or disable the feature?

Only administrators can enable or disable the Trash Bin feature.

Note: If the Trash Bin feature is disabled, deleting files and folders will permanently remove them from Vault.

### Who can delete or permanently delete entities from the Trash Bin?

The administrators have the permission to delete any object, regardless of who created it. Users who create an entity also have permission to delete or restore it. The deleted entities are moved to the Trash Bin, where they can be restored at any time. However, only administrators can permanently delete entities from the Trash Bin. The administrators can delete entities without restrictions, overriding rules related to child entities or checked-out items. The following permissions allow them to permanently delete entities:

* File Delete Conditional
* File Delete Unconditional

### Important points to note:

* A new "Delete from Trash Bin" permission has been introduced.
* Users with delete access, including specific special users, can restore entities from the Trash Bin.
* Archiving actions generally apply to entities within the Trash Bin.
* The purge action does not apply to entities in the Trash Bin.
* Entities are treated individually, except for visualization files (*DWF*), which are deleted and restored along with their associated design files.

For additional information about the Trash Bin feature, see [Trash Bin](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=moving-to-trashbin).

**Parent page:** [2026 Updates and Enhancements](WN-2026-UPDATES.htm)

##### Administration Enhancements (What's New in 2025.2)

# Administration Enhancements (What's New in 2025.2)

Check out the new capabilities and enhancements available for administration in this release.

## Client Configuration

As an administrator, you can now centrally manage and deploy configuration settings, such as Vault options and Vault Copy Design options, on client machines.
These are the default distributed options configured when users access their systems. Users can modify these distributed options locally to optimize their tasks and improve efficiency.
[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/centralized-management-of-all-configuration-data/idi-p/3511758)

Note:

1. Available in Vault Professional and Vault Office only.
2. You must have an "Administrator" or "Configuration Administrator" role to manage and deploy client configuration settings.

**Distributed Options – Vault Client and Vault Copy Design**

This is the initial view deployed when the user accesses the system. As an administrator, you can:

* Configure the Vault Options.
* Access the **Client Configuration** tab on the **Global Settings** dialog or access the **Manage Distributed Options** on the **Vault Options** dialog and Vault Copy Design dialog to:
  + Distribute the Vault Options.
  + Reset the Vault Options to the system default or distributed option.

For more information, see [Vault Options](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-18A5B6A9-933C-46AF-9865-79A15C3ED6E5), [Manage Distributed Options](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=manage-distributed-options), [Client Configuration Settings](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=CLIENT-CONFIGURATION-SETTINGS)

## User Management - Account Name Display

You can now add a column for “Account Name” in the User and Group Management dialog. An account can be tied to different “Account” types, such as Autodesk ID, Vault Account, and Windows Authentication, and may have different values for the account name of the respective account types.

Note: The “Account Name” value is sequenced according to the “Account” types.

## Purge Enhancement

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/document-purge-skip-versions-with-any-comment/idi-p/12680421)

You can now enter an asterisk (\*) in the Comments field of the Purge Wizard dialog for “Exclude versions where comment contains:”. Any file version which has a comment will be excluded from the purge.

Note: This asterisk (\*) workflow is supported only for 'Versions not controlled by Lifecycles.’

Learn about the enhancements made to the AutoCAD Vault add-in.

## Distributed Options – AutoCAD Vault Add-in

As an administrator, you can now manage and deploy configuration settings of AutoCAD Vault Add-in options on the add-in application machines.

1. Select **Vault Options** from the Vault ribbon.
2. Configure status icons, ignore AutoCAD View only changes to manipulate the view in the drawing file and manage prompts for the AutoCAD Vault add-in. You can also suppress certain dialogs for a faster workflow.
3. Click **Apply** to save the changes.
4. Click **Manage Distributed Options** to select the options to distribute.  
   You can distribute:

   * Use large status icons
   * Ignore AutoCAD View Only changes
   * Configure prompts
   * Dialog and Suppression Settings
5. Click the checkbox beside the option you want to distribute.
6. Click **Apply** to distribute the options.

For more information, see [Configure Vault Options for the AutoCAD Vault Add-in](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-69F45FF0-9786-4178-800E-A0F0534D41D6) and [Manage Distributed Options](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=manage-distributed-options).

# General Enhancements (What’s New in Vault 2025.2)

Check out some of the general enhancements made to the Vault Client.

## Always Reuse Library Files in Copy Design

"Always Reuse Library Files" option has been added to the copy designs options.

This helps to reuse library files in copy design. This option is cached and value is maintained on the local client machine. In addition vault administrators can choose to distribute this option using distribute copy design options capability added with Vault 2025.2 update.

## Support for property values as hyperlinks

Vault now supports using hyperlinks in property 'Value' field for text type properties more better utilization of properties. WebURL and email address hyperlinks are supported.

You can :

1. Add property value which are hyperlinks using suggested format.
2. Directly open the hyperlinks provided as property values, by doing Ctrl+Click on the property value.
3. Customize grid views to add the property with hyperlink values for ease of use.

For more information, see Edit Properties, [Edit Properties with the Properties Grid](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-AD7174E2-B36C-40C2-9608-2D7A7965BD40) help section.

## Thin Client Link

You now have the thin client link available for all vault entitities available as property in thick client. You can customize views to add this property 'Link to Thin Client' to easily access thin client OR export the thin client links from vault client.

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/link-to-item-file-in-thin-client-as-a-file-item-property/idi-p/8322488)

## Reset Vault account password from thin client

You can now reset the password for vault account users from thin client. New user option 'Change Vault Account Password' is now available for users to change their password.

Data Standard for Inventor and AutoCAD replaced the breadcrumb selection of Vault folders with a graphical Select Vault Location browser tree. Along with this enhancement, the ‘Vault Location’ field replaces the local path. The last used location is preset next time a new file is saved.

##### General Enhancements (What’s New in Vault 2025.1)

# General Enhancements (What’s New in Vault 2025.1)

Check out some of the general enhancements made to the Vault Client.

## Synchronize properties

The "Synchronize Properties" command has been added to the Records tab of the Change Order List and Change Order Detail. A Vault Ideas submission

On the Records tab, you can now utilize the "Synchronize Properties" command. This allows you to synchronize properties directly in the ECO records or files grid, eliminating the need to search through multiple folders to locate the updated files.

You can:

1. Right-click on the ECO Records tab.
2. Select the "Synchronize Properties" command.
3. This action will synchronize the properties.

Remember that the "Synchronize Properties" command is a handy tool designed to streamline and simplify your workflow.

## Using '@me' for Personalized Searches

Vault now supports '@me' keyword in the 'Value' field for more personalized searches. It automatically replaces '@me' with the current user's display name across both basic and advanced searches.

You can use '@me' with all string properties and operators (is, is not, contains, does not contain) and across all clients including thick, thin, mobile, and add-ins.

It's also backward compatible with legacy clients, ensuring its use even if accessing a 2025.1 server with a 2025 RTM or 2024 client.

## Vault Copy Design

* The option “Remove BOM Objects from Parents Only” is removed from the Options menu.

You now have the options to reuse library files to drive design reuse:

* By default, the option “Show Children” > Library Files” in the View menu is set to ON. This setting persists in the Copy Design dialog.
* You can now set reuse action to the selected library files using the actions in the right-click menu:

  + Reuse Library Files
  + Reuse Branch Library Files
* If you want to set reuse action to all the library files, you can select the action in the Actions menu:

  + Reuse All Library Files

For more information, see Copy Design Interface, [Copy Design](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-CA59F765-6BE5-47C6-8EF5-B9D427854D97) help section.

## Folder Focus change after 'Move' operation

You can determine the Focus Location after the Move Operation in Vault Client, the focus can either be on the source location OR the target location. This can be acheived by editing the XML file within the Vault installation directory.

Refer to the [General Vault Tasks](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=CFG-SET-FOCUS-LOCATION) help topic for more information about this feature.

## Resetting Dialogs locations to resolve display issues

Users with varying monitor setups may experience difficulties with dialog boxes. These dialogs may not display on the primary screen, particularly when transitioning between multi-screen systems and a single laptop. To resolve this issue, command line utility can be used to reset the dialog locations.

Refer to the [General Vault Tasks](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=TBS-DIALOGS-NOT-ON-CURRENT-SCREEN) help topic for more information about this feature.

##### Email Notifications on Lifecycle Transitions

# Email Notifications on Lifecycle Transitions

Boost collaboration within your team using Vault's new Lifecycle Email Notification feature.

When designs move to the next stage, the relevant team members are automatically notified via email that work is to be done. This ensures that team members are promptly informed when new data is ready for their attention, eliminating the need for direct communication.

![](../images/new-2025-emailnotificationsettings-16-9.jpg)

What's New:

* Set up email notifications within Vault to alert selected members when a specified lifecycle state transition occurs, using a pre-defined email template.
* Create custom email templates, including the subject line and body, in a central location accessible to all users.
* Automated notifications will be triggered and sent whenever a state transition occurs.

For more information, see [Configure Event Notifications](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-383F15D8-B868-4D19-895F-59D1EB8AAF6A).

##### Administration Enhancements

# Administration Enhancements

Check out the new capabilities and enhancements available for administration in this release.

## Password Policy

Enforce a strong password policy for enhanced security.

![](../images/new-2025-passwordpolicy-16-9.jpg)

As an administrator, you can now enforce a password policy to prevent unauthorized access and protect against potential security breaches. Administrators can enforce users to create passwords that meet specific criteria such as a minimum length, a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.

If the administrator enforces a password policy and the current password fails to meet the set requirements, the system will prompt end users to reset their password on their next login. Thin Client users must log in through Thick Client or contact administrators to change the password.

For more information, see [Configure Password Policy](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-D57A07AC-A396-4AF6-8B1B-25BA0A66D90A).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/implement-more-modern-password-policy-abality/idc-p/9619200)

## Purge Updates

**Purge folders**

Like purging file/item versions, administrators and project administrators can now purge all content files within a selected project. This helps to save the time and effort required to manually choose and purge each file individually. For more information, see [Purge Folder](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-F8FCEAA2-EB9A-421F-BE1C-280407C48BDF).

**Purge on lifecycle transition**

Enable Purge under Transaction actions to schedule the purging of any files, folders, or items that change during the corresponding state transition.

![](../images/new-2025-purge-16-9-edited.jpg)

For more information, see [Edit Lifecycle State Transition](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B4443A39-A621-4E14-8A11-484EFBF3DB90).

All selected files, folders, and items are purged using the selective purge server task in the ADMS Console.

##### General Enhancements

# General Enhancements

Check out some of the general enhancements made to the Vault Client.

## Criteria-Based Basic Search

Use the existing saved search to apply the search criteria to the basic search (grid).

![](../images/new-2025-searchcriterial-16-9-edited.jpg)

The search criteria entered in the Quick Find bar or in the Find dialog can be saved and used on any folder.

If the criteria applied to the basic search (grid) don't match the workspaces parameter or the folder parameter, the search is performed within your current folder. If the option is selected, it will also search within subfolders.

The search criteria are saved by default when an Advanced find (property condition) search is saved by the user, and it appears in the "Apply Criteria of" list.

For more information, see [Perform a search](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-0C7AA7BF-9158-4F8D-B312-CE0B2ED174A2).

## Vault Basic Copy Design

Removed the old Copy Design in Vault Basic and replaced it with the Copy Design functionality in Vault Professional.

Copy Design is one of the most powerful features of Autodesk Vault. Engineers are leveraging existing designs by reusing them to save design time or by copying and updating an existing design to reduce design time. Besides the reduced modeling time, design reuse impacts the cost and time savings in downstream engineering, manufacturing, and purchasing.

The new Copy Design provides more flexibility and control over how your designs are copied.

* Copy Design is now a modeless dialog with a toolbar. It can now remain open while you use the Vault Client for other commands as well as add files to be copied.
* You can customize the layout of the Copy Design application by adding and removing column fields, controlling whether grid lines and banding are shown, enabling automatic column-sizing, selecting which Navigation Panels display and which navigation buttons are displayed.
* The Action column displays the current action assigned to a file so you can tell at-a-glance how the file will be handled. Actions include Copy, Copy To, Reuse, Replace, Exclude, and Auto.
* The Navigation Panels help users identify important information about their copied designs and apply certain actions to multiple files at once. Users can filter by file status, view the source and destination of copied files, and explore the folder structure of the copied design.
* Administrators can define rule sets that determine property values for the copied files when certain conditions are met.
* Use the Numbering Scheme Panel to see the old file name, the new name, any prefixes, the base name, and any post-fixes. Administrators can add unique numbering schemes for copy design operations by creating a new numbering scheme in the Vault Client. Users can select from different numbering schemes so that each copied file adheres to a naming convention that suits their design environment.

Refer to the [Copy Design](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-E4C6B707-448D-467E-B7FD-00625A98B791) help topic for more detailed information about this feature.

##### Client Enhancements

# Client Enhancements

Check out the enhancements made to the Vault Client.

## Customize Rename Columns

We have made a few enhancements to the Rename wizard in this release.

![](../images/new-2024-2-renamewizard-16-9.png)

You can:

* Add property columns in the rename wizard.
* Change the order of the columns, the size of the columns, and the alignment of the data in the columns.
* Sort columns in ascending or descending order.
* Add or remove the default prefix/suffix under the numbering scheme. You can also choose not to use any default prefix/suffix.
* Copy/paste values between multiple columns.

Note: The ability to customize columns has been extended to the Purge, Export, and Replace wizards.

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/customize-rename-wizard/idi-p/6333651)

## DWF and DWFX Support for Shared Views

Vault now supports publishing of DWFs and DWFx files to Shared Views, making it easier to collaborate and share your designs with others. This is already supported in Vault Mobile.

**Parent page:** [2024.2 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2024-2.htm)


##### Administration Enhancements

# Administration Enhancements

Check out the new capabilities and enhancements available for administration in this release.

## Client Configuration

As an administrator, you can now centrally manage and deploy basic configuration settings such as grid view, saved search, and shortcuts on the client machines. These are the default distributed settings configured when users access their system. Users can copy or modify the distributed settings locally to optimize their tasks and improve efficiency.

![](../images/new-2024-2-clientconfig-16-9.png)

Note:

* Available in Vault Professional and Vault Office only.
* You must have an "Administrator" or "Configuration Administrator" role to manage and deploy client configuration settings.

**Distributed Views**

This is the initial view deployed when the user accesses the system. As an administrator, you can:

* Copy or modify the distributed view.
* Rename the distributed view.
* Delete the distributed view.

For more information, see [Customize the View](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-D5AE6CDC-50FA-47A4-84D0-CA0A54C4E6D6) and [Manage Custom Views](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-7659AEA4-65F9-470C-A298-620AB2FB40B6).

**Distributed Searches**

This is the initial search criteria deployed when the user accesses the system. As an administrator, you can:

* Copy the distributed saved search folder.
* Rename the distributed saved search folder.
* Delete the distributed saved search folder.

For more information, see [Save a Search](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-6B47BD0B-67EB-42B5-B6EC-199D9C4143EF) and [Manage Saved Searches](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-6B47BD0B-67EB-42B5-B6EC-199D9C4143EF).

**Distributed Shortcuts**

This is the default shortcut deployed when the user accesses the system. As an administrator, you can:

* Copy the distributed shortcut.
* Rename the distributed shortcut.
* Delete the distributed shortcut.

For more information, see [Manage Shortcuts](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-8B57D58A-0130-4C7B-87A7-D2AD43B5EBD9).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/my-search-folders-saved-in-vault-not-on-client/idi-p/5118276)

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/centralized-management-of-all-configuration-data/idi-p/3511758)

## File Store Validation

Added the capability to choose the option not to run the file store validation during backup.

For more information, see [Back Up or Restore a Vault](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-FAEEA4AC-D642-4136-9EB0-1058EA3F5DC3).

## User Management

**User and Group Count Display**

You can now view the total count and the number of selected users (and groups) in the User and Group Management dialog. The count is based on the displayed number of users and groups.

![](../images/new-2024-2-usercount.jpg)

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/user-and-group-management-display-number-of-users-and-groups/idi-p/10874427)

**Resize Add Groups Dialog**

You can now adjust the size of the "Add Group" dialog to avoid scrolling through the extensive list of groups.

![](../images/new-2024-2-addgroupresize.jpg)

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/make-add-groups-resizable/idi-p/10871437)

## "Created By" System Property Mapping

Previously, there was no mapping available for "Created By" system property. We've now added "Vault to File" mapping for this property in the latest release. You can leverage this mapping to get the Created By property directly into file properties. You can also map this property to multiple property source providers.

## PDF Property Management

A new PDF property provider is added to manage PDF file properties in Vault.

![](../images/new-2024-2-pdfproperty.png)

You can:

* Create PDF property mapping.
* Modify PDF properties in Vault.

The PDF property is also available when using Copy Design.

For more information, see [Map Properties](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-915561C8-1143-4E68-BE41-37376FA39A58).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/allow-the-vault-to-map-custom-properties-of-pdf-files/idi-p/7046110)

##### Administration Enhancements

# Administration Enhancements

Learn about the new capabilities and enhancements available for administration in this release.

## Group Manager

This Vault release introduces a new Group Manager, a user who can manage the group members by assigning existing or new users to specified groups. The Group Manager can manage only the groups they are given to, allowing for distributed administration of groups.

![](../images/new-2024-1-groupmanager-16-9.png)

As a group manager, you can:

* View groups with profile attributes.
* Add or remove members.

For more information, see [Manage Groups](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-8C6B2C3C-5197-406F-97BD-2A21B7840579).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/user-and-group-management-for-special-roles-security/idi-p/11075783)

## Enforce Unique File Name Enhancement

With unique file names enforced, files in the Vault must each have a unique, identifying name. However, depending on the folder structure, the Inventor design data and template location have the same file names. So, if a unique file name check is enforced, those files may fail to check-in.

The enforce unique file name enhancement allows you to enforce unique file names based on the file extension or folder location. You can enable files with specific extensions or files in specified folders to have duplicate file names.

![](../images/new-2024-1-enforceuniquefilename.png)

While enforcing the unique file name, you can:

* Find duplicate file names in the Vault to help resolve any file name conflicts.
* Exclude enforcement by file extension.
* Exclude enforcement by folder.

For more information, see [Enforce Unique File Names](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B95F67C8-7843-4435-B632-4996A97FFEA5).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/accept-non-unique-file-name-in-specific-folders/idi-p/4942318)

**Parent page:** [2024.1 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2024-1.htm)


##### Client Enhancements

# Client Enhancements

Learn about the enhancements made to the Vault Client.

## Get Folder

The new Get Folder functionality lets you download a copy of the folder structure from the Vault to the working folder without getting the files. This helps to avoid creating duplicate folders while copying or moving the folders, hence, reducing the time to manage and organize the folder structure. For more information, see [Get Folder from Vault](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-721EE932-D3C9-41C1-8BD6-3D7EEB5FBFD3).

![](../images/new-2024-1-getfolder.png)

You can also use Get Folder while performing the Copy Folder operation. This allows you to download a copy of the folder structure to a local working folder while copying the folder to a set location. For more information, see [Copy Folder](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-8720E24C-4972-4E71-AAE1-1AB1524FF913).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/get-all-working-folders-option/idc-p/11847178#M12777)

## Display name mapping

Until now, if the display name and the username are different, the property value for the file property shows the display name. However, the property value is set to "User" in the Copy Design rule set behavior. With this update, you can choose the property value (User or Display name) you want to display while defining the Copy Design rule set behavior.

![](../images/new-2024-1-displaynamemapping.png)

For more information, see [Copy Design - Action Rule Sets](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B82E97BF-3ADF-41CA-A5C4-A4C4194C981F#GUID-B82E97BF-3ADF-41CA-A5C4-A4C4194C981F__GUID-12AA858C-647A-4D2A-A343-667ECB9CA5BF).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/enable-sort-order-for-display-name-field-in-user-and-group/idi-p/10926787)

**Parent page:** [2024.1 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2024-1.htm)


##### Thin Client Enhancements

# Thin Client Enhancements

Learn about the enhancements made to the Thin Client.

## Show/Hide Folders

Use Show/Hide Folders ![](../images/icon-showhidefolders.png) to expand or collapse the folder view in the Files workspace.

If you have a long list of files and folders, you can hide the folders that aren't relevant or make them show when required. You don't need to scroll through all the folders in the main data table to view specific files or folders. You can still navigate through the folder tree navigation in the left pane.

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/collapse-folder-view-in-vault-thin-client/idi-p/10952841)

## Full View vs. Paged View

Select the view icon ![](../images/icon-thin-client-fullview.png) to toggle between full and paged views to load and display data.

For more information, see [Thin Client - Interface](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-755B8891-AA7F-489B-8770-168D39C4941D).

## User Initials

The logged-in user initials now appear consistent across the Vault Client. The profile icon ![](../images/icon-newthinclient-profile-small.png)displays the user initials based on the following behavior:

* If the first name and last name fields are available in Vault, the profile icon displays the first letter from the first name and last name.
* If only the first name field is available in Vault, the profile icon only displays the first letter of the first name. If only the last name field is available in Vault, the profile icon only shows the first letter of the last name.
* If both the first and last names are unavailable in Vault, the profile icon displays the first letter from the display name.

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/thin-client-user-initals/idi-p/10953999)

## Define Search Columns

As an administrator, you can now define headers for the search workspace and enforce the same for all users. When enforced, non-admin users can't change the default search columns. For more information, see [Work with Vault Data](GUID-B363C783-FEA4-479E-9F97-1D0A8DD0C1E0).

##### Copy Folder

# Copy Folder

Organize your data across folders and subfolders without transferring files.

Use the Copy Folder functionality to copy folders, including subfolders, folder permissions, and properties to efficiently start a new project from a previous folder structure. It is an effective way to consistently organize your data across many projects.

![](../images/new-2024-copyfolder-16-9.png)

For more information, see [Copy Folder](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-8720E24C-4972-4E71-AAE1-1AB1524FF913).

##### Automated CAD Formats for Document Control

# Automated CAD Formats for Document Control

Automatically publish and manage DXF and STEP files from CAD files within the design release process.

To accelerate design documentation, we have added support for DXF and STEP format similar to PDF.

![](../images/new-2024-publishoption-16-9.png)

## Configurable DXF and STEP Settings

Vault 2024 automatically renders DXF and STEP formats from CAD design files using the same settings as the authoring CAD systems. In addition, it supports the 2D and 3D design files from AutoCAD and Inventor drawing files.

For more information, see [Configure DXF Publishing Options](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-57BC9F5B-FBAC-4003-80BA-8C7A352DD503) and [Configure STEP Publishing Options](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-BE2CA612-EB3A-40BE-ACB3-DB530E5926D2).

## Create DXF and STEP upon State Change

Administrators can now configure settings to automatically publish DXF and STEP files for document control at any lifecycle state. During this transition, Vault's Job Processor automatically updates the drawing references and properties to ensure an accurate DXF and STEP representation.

For more information, see [Publish Files](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-F05BFEAF-A362-4070-BBA6-F3A74602967E).

## Create DXF and STEP manually

You can manually create a DXF or STEP of a CAD file using the Create DXF and Create STEP commands available in the toolbar and the context menu. Use these commands to create a DXF or STEP without going through lifecycle state change for a CAD file. Enable the command in the Vault Settings dialog.

For more information, see [Create File](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-EE6877E0-BBEB-4FB2-8B08-F9052F6FCB32).

## Automatic File Attachment

DXF and STEP files created for document control are automatically attached to their accompanying design file.

## Publish and Store Files

PDF, DXF, and STEP files published for document control can be stored in the vault or outside the vault on a local drive. In addition, administrators may designate a local folder for document control similar to the vault folder structure.

For more information, see [DXF Publish Location](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-5D7A9317-7428-49D9-90F0-59FC69D6C569) and [STEP Publish Location](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-7D1947BD-8A06-4110-8115-5DE0506F803D).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/step-amp-dxf-publish-in-vault-as-dwf-workflow/idi-p/6665277)

**Parent page:** [2024 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2024.htm)


##### Peer Review for Lifecycle State Transition

# Peer Review for Lifecycle State Transition

Learn about the new capability available to administer lifecycle state change.

![](../images/new-2024-peerreview-16-9.png)

As an administrator, you can configure a peer review check to be met before a state change can occur. The controlling mechanism checks whether the current user is not the same user who has executed the previous state change. This functionality can be used to facilitate delegation of authority and increase transparency.

* You can define multiple transition criteria determining when a state transition can occur.
* Once the criteria are met, the system checks the user in the 'From' and 'To' states. The user who set the file in the 'From' state of the transition won't be able to change the state to the 'To' state.

For more information, see [Edit Lifecycle State Transitions](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B4443A39-A621-4E14-8A11-484EFBF3DB90).

**Parent page:** [2024 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2024.htm)


##### Administration Enhancements

# Administration Enhancements

Learn about the new capabilities and enhancements available for administration in this release.

## Backup and Restore Enhancements

![](../images/new-2024-backuprestore-16-9.png)

What's new:

* **Backup databases without any files**

  As an administrator, you can backup vault databases during the backup process to save space and time. When the "Backup databases" option is selected, the file store isn't backed up.
* **Select vaults or libraries for backup**

  You can select the vaults and libraries you want to backup to save time and space. Vault and libraries that are not selected for backup don't appear in the restored environment.
* **Use existing file store files on the local machine**

  You can use existing files in the file store during restore.

  Note: Ensure correct file stores are copied to the destination folder.
* **No file store validation**

  As an administrator, you can choose the option not to run the file store validation during a restore. When file store validation is not executed, the restored backup doesn't have a file store.
* **Redirect file store**

  You can redirect a vault to a new file store location. Different from moving the file store, shifting the file store location allows the administrator to prepare a new place for the file store while the existing file store is in use. Once the new location is ready, redirect the vault to the new location without moving files during the operation.

For more information, see [Back up or Restore a Vault](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-FAEEA4AC-D642-4136-9EB0-1058EA3F5DC3) and [Redirect the Vault File Store](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-163CCB73-F6E1-4E09-ACF5-D99B13A8FC1E).

## Purge Enhancements

Use Export Candidates to generate a pre-report (.csv file) that shows the list of purge candidates.

Note: The pre-report includes all file versions that can be purged. However, some candidate file versions can't be purged if some non-purgeable parent files use them.

For more information, see [Purge Files in a Vault](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-379CAADD-69B5-4408-B402-F421208DD574).

**Parent page:** [2024 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2024.htm)


##### Inventor Vault Add-in Enhancements

# Inventor Vault Add-in Enhancements

Learn about the enhancements made to the Inventor Vault add-in.

## Inventor Design Data and Template Management

In this release, we have added the ability to map Vault folders to Inventor design data and templates and use them in the Inventor Vault add-in. This will help to manage different versions of the design data and templates that are modified by the administrator or CAD manager.

As an administrator, you can:

* Manage templates and design data files in Vault.
* Map Inventor templates and design data to Vault project file.

As a user, you can:

* Download the mapped templates and design data files.
* Get the latest templates and design data files.

For more information, see [Map Vault Folders in Autodesk Inventor](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-32AE0C6F-AD1B-495E-8DAD-CC4D47EF28F8).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/enhance-management-of-inventor-design-data-and-templates-in/idi-p/4382756)

### Removed Inventor View from the Viewer Options

The "Inventor View" option to view the Inventor files has been removed from the Vault settings options. The "Inventor Read-only Mode" is now the default setting to preview the Inventor files.

### Inventor Read-only Mode for Viewing Files

The "Inventor Read-only Mode" is now the default setting for viewing the Inventor files.

You can view the Inventor files for read-only purposes. You can't edit or update the files using Vault commands in the Inventor read-only mode. The Vault administrator can provide read-only access to the users who need just to view the Inventor files.

Note: The Vault add-in for Inventor Read-only Mode is only available for Vault Professional.

For more information, see [View Files in a Vault](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-E1B8190D-ED0B-4A9C-BEC5-D8167360EF6C).

**Parent page:** [2024 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2024.htm)


##### Thin Client Enhancements

# Thin Client Enhancements

Learn about the enhancements made to the Thin Client.

## Expand all/Collapse all

Expand or collapse rows in a tree view on the File (Uses and Where Used tabs) and Items (Where Used and BOM) details page.

* Click the Collapse all icon in the tree view action bar to collapse all the rows to view only the top-level node.
* Click the Expand all icon in the tree view action bar to expand the collapsed rows (parent rows with children) so that all rows are displayed in a tree view.

![](../images/thinclient-expandcollapseall-icons.png)

## Expand all Children/Collapse all Children

To expand the collapsed rows in a tree view, hover over the parent row and click the ellipses icon (…). Select "Expand all Children" to display all the child rows. Similarly, to collapse the expanded rows, select "Collapse all Children".

![](../images/thinclient-expandcollapseallchildren.png)

For more information, see [Thin Client - The Interface](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-755B8891-AA7F-489B-8770-168D39C4941D).

##### Punch Tool from Vault (Inventor Vault Add-in)

# Punch Tool from Vault (Inventor Vault Add-in)

Learn about the enhancements made to the Inventor Vault add-in.

![](../images/new-2023-2-insertpunchtoolfromvault-16-9.png)

A new "Punch Tool from Vault" command is added to the Sheet Metal tab in Inventor. It enables you to browse for a 3D iFeature shape from the Vault to be inserted into the sheet metal face.

Sheet Metal Punch tools are iFeatures with extra attributes that cut simple or complex hole shapes in the face of your part, including across a bend. You must have a 2D sketch with at least one hole center point before using the Punch Tool from Vault command.

For more information, see [Insert Punch Tool from Vault](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-68ADA7AF-DAD9-477A-A96B-C57C27B88565).

**Parent page:** [2023.2 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023-2.htm)


##### Thin Client Enhancements

# Thin Client Enhancements

Learn about several enhancements made to the Thin Client.

## Improved search

Many improvements are made to make the overall search experience more efficient and intuitive.

![](../images/new-2023-2-thinclient-searchenhancement-16-9.png)

You can use the following search features:

* Locate files and folders in different workspaces. The current workspace is automatically selected when you click the Search bar.
* Use Basic Search to look for any property that contains the search keyword. You can perform the search in the current folder and/or include subfolders or find the latest version of the file and items only. By default, the "Include Subfolders" option is selected.
* Use Advanced Search to create complex queries with multiple search criteria. A search criterion consists of a property, a condition, and a value.
* Save the advanced search with desired criteria to your bookmark in your web browser and reuse them quickly.
* Use expand/collapse in the Advanced Search panel to view/hide the search parameters. By default, the search panel is expanded.

For more information, see [Thin Client - Search](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-D44E6840-2CF2-4A78-A576-E7F6245279AD).

## Set default columns

As an administrator, you can now configure the required columns and enforce the same for all users. When enforced, non-admin users cannot change the default columns.

![](../images/new-2023-2-thinclient-defaultcolumns.png)

For more information, see [Thin Client - Work with Vault Data](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B363C783-FEA4-479E-9F97-1D0A8DD0C1E0).

## Select Vault to connect

Vault 2023-2 allows you to view all available vaults and select the vault you need to connect to at the time of signing in to the Thin Client. The vault name in the URL changes upon selecting a vault. You can also change vaults in the Thin Client interface after signing in to the Thin Client.

![](../images/new-2023-2-thinclient-vault-login.png)

For more information, see [Thin Client - Get Started](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B0A83CDC-490A-457D-8FE6-1744955E83AA).

**Parent page:** [2023.2 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023-2.htm)

##### Job Processor Enhancements

# Job Processor Enhancements

Learn about the new enhancements available for Job Processor administration in this release.

As an administrator, you can now enable and set automatic retries for failed jobs. You can set the maximum retries between 1 and 10. By default, the maximum retry is set to 1. The system reverts to manual retry once the job fails the set automatic retries.

* Select "Enable Automatic Retry" to enable automatic retries for failed jobs. For more information, see [Integration Global Settings](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B6013887-7043-4A37-8645-9C967CE26EBF).
* Configure to set the number of automatic retries for failed jobs. For more information, see [Configure Job Retries](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-0BA0E2A1-748B-4745-B8B0-C2CC7DB2EE5F).

![](../images/new-2023-1-jobprocessor-16-9.png)

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/automatically-retry-failed-or-server-busy-jobs-in-the-job-queue/idi-p/7040761)

**Parent page:** [2023.1 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023-1.htm)


##### Copy Design Improvements

# Copy Design Improvements

Learn about the enhancements made to the Copy Design.

## Copy Paste in Autonumbering Texts

With 2023.1 it is now possible to copy and paste a list of editable values in the Copy Design numbering panel. Currently, you can only edit one string at a time.

Use the copy and paste functionality to edit multiple row values in an Excel spreadsheet and then copy them to the Copy Design with one operation.

For more information, see [Copy Design - Numbering Schemes Panel](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-02EB242B-3766-4CDC-91D9-6B04FF94F028).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/allow-copy-paste-of-values-in-copy-design/idc-p/10910783)

## Export File List

During a copy operation, if there are any files with restrictions, a warning dialog displays a list of restricted files highlighted in red. You can export the restricted file list to an external file (xls, xlsx, txt, htm, html) for reference.

Use the Export functionality to export the restricted files highlighted during the copy operation.

For more information, see [Copy Design - Walkthrough](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B92ADE25-369A-4223-93C5-CE437DD55181).

![](../images/new-2023-1-copydesign-16-9.png)

**Parent page:** [2023.1 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023-1.htm)


##### General Enhancements

# General Enhancements

Learn about the enhancements made to the Vault Client.

## "Has Drawing" Property

To allow all design and drawing files to have the same lifecycle definition, the "Has Drawing" system property value for drawings is set to True Always. You can ensure that the objects are only released if an associated drawing exists by using the property check-in lifecycle transition, and hence be able to identify and filter the components without an associated drawing

For more information, see [Open a File from Vault with Vault Client](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-5BCDD9A4-8A2A-489E-9C02-4C51F6065E9D).

## "Has Markup" and "Has Markup Historical" Properties

Two new "Has Markup" and "Has Markup Historical" system properties are added to help identify files or versions with associated markup data. With these properties, you can filter all files within a project that have markup data both historical or latest.

![](../images/new-2023-1-has-markup-historial-16-9.png)

## Viewer

In this release, we made several enhancements to the Viewer that apply to Thick Client, Thin Client, and Vault Mobile.

**Unsaved Markups**

A warning message is added to notify about the unsaved edits. After the confirmation, all unsaved markups are discarded.

**Markup Count**

You can now see a number on the markup icon indicating how many markups are associated with the file. Click the markup icon to view the markup details in the Markup Browsing Panel.

![](../images/new-2023-1-markupcount.png)

For more information, see [Markup](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-E2624D7F-772F-46F4-B0F6-876AB837E00D).

**Sheet Color**

The drawing background color is removed and no longer present when using the Print command.

## Refresh

The Refresh button is added in the Inventor/AutoCAD Show Details pane to refresh the content.

![](../images/new-2023-1-refresh-showdetails.png)

## Open Drawing from Vault Client

In the file context menu, use the newly added Open Drawing command to open the associated drawing file from the Vault Client.

![](../images/new-2023-1-opendrawing.png)

Note: The Open Drawing command is supported in Inventor and SolidWorks only.

For more information, see [Open a File from Vault with Vault Client](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-5BCDD9A4-8A2A-489E-9C02-4C51F6065E9D).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/open-linked-idw-in-right-click-menu/idi-p/10673181)

## Folder and Library Icons

In this release, the folder and library icons are redesigned to reflect the same color scheme as categories.

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/folder-colors-in-vault-client-not-visible-at-thin-client/idi-p/10936120)

## Light/Dark Theme Support

User Interface theme is now available in Autodesk Vault Basic and Vault Workgroup. Switch between Dark, Light, and old Classic themes to reflect the visual alignment with other adjacent products from Autodesk. For more information, see [Configure Vault Options](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-18A5B6A9-933C-46AF-9865-79A15C3ED6E5).

## Inventor Add-In Updates

**Load, Unload Data Standard**

In Autodesk Inventor, use the Load, Unload button on the Vault ribbon to enable or disable the Data Standard add-in.

![](../images/new-2023-1-load-unload-buttons.png)

For more information, see [Data Standard - Add-ins](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-5952EA7B-E9C8-450F-9FF2-ADD6EFB729FE).

**Update Item BOM**

Use the Update command in the Show Details BOM tab context menu to update the Item BOM. With this enhancement, you don't need to go to the Uses tab or Vault Explorer Item to get the Assign/Update command.

![](../images/new-2023-1-updatebom.png)

For more information, see [Show Details in Inventor](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-6144B56D-516A-406F-8FDA-759650869815).

**Parent page:** [2023.1 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023-1.htm)


##### Thin Client Enhancements

# Thin Client Enhancements

Learn about several enhancements made to the Thin Client.

![](../images/new-2023-1-thinclient-enhancements-16-9.png)

## Show/hide Unreleased Files in Items

In the Administrator Settings dialog, select "Show released files only" to display the item with associated files in released as well as the non-released state in the "Associated Files" tab.

## Customize the Change Order View

You can set a filter in the Change Orders workspace to only display change orders that are in Open states (Open, Work, Check, Review, and Approved). All change orders in Closed or Canceled state are hidden from the view. By default, the Open States filter is turned on.

For more information, see [Thin Client - Change Orders](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-E4E18888-CD2A-422C-9A1A-A8A0668A54CC).

## View Files

* **View file in Items workspace** - You can now view the file in Viewer in a new browser tab without a need to go to the Items workspace to view the file. Previously, when you clicked the object in the Items workspace under the Associated files tab, you were routed to the Files workspace to view the file. For more information, see [Thin Client - Items](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-FF8CA8D4-D13B-42B2-9436-8AF3B028A76A).
* **View image file** - You can now view the image file on the View tab directly without a need to download it.

  [A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/vault-thinclient-2022-preview-of-images-bmp-png-jpg/idc-p/11299272#M11856)
* **Open file in the browser** - For non-design files, if the file extension is supported in the browser, you can open the file in the browser. Otherwise, the file is downloaded on the machine. The "Open File in Browser" command is available in the View tab on the file's details page. For more information, see [Thin Client - The Viewer](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-E7707879-4505-434A-AEAA-761794F720F2).

## Print Data to Excel

You can now extract data from the Thin Client to an Excel spreadsheet and preserve the layout at the same time when copying the data from the print preview window.

For more information, see [Thin Client - Print](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-A8B9C67E-175B-4439-A1C0-A0F51688A8DE).

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/plot-feature-is-missing-in-bill-of-materials-tab-on-vault-thin/idi-p/10560815)

## Folder and Library Icons

In this release, the folder and library icons were redesigned to reflect the same color scheme as categories.

[A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/folder-colors-in-vault-client-not-visible-at-thin-client/idi-p/10936120)

## Update Visualization

To make it easier to update the visualization file for the currently selected file version, we added the command "Update Visualization" in the ActionBar.

![](../images/command-updatevisualization.png)

For more information, see [Thin Client - Work with Vault Data](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-B363C783-FEA4-479E-9F97-1D0A8DD0C1E0).

## Username Cache

In this release, we added the provision to cache username in the browser for easy input. You no longer need to input the username every time you login to the Thin Client.

##### Instance Properties

# Instance Properties

This release adds support for Inventor Instance Properties in Vault which enables you to assign properties to individual component instances.

![](../images/new-2023-instanceproperties-16-9.png)

Instance properties work the same way as Item property occurrence within the Vault Bill of Materials (BOM). Items with the same part number are grouped by the instance property value. If no instance properties exist, the BOM works as in the previous releases.

For more information, see [Instance Properties and Vault](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-26DB79EC-957B-4A11-A260-5D3359662904).

**Parent page:** [2023 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023.htm)


##### User Interface Enhancements

# User Interface Enhancements

A new user interface theme is part of the enhancements for Vault 2023. Learn about enhancements made to the user interface.

![](../images/new-2023-uitheme-16-9.png)

Various parts of the Vault user interface underwent a refresh to demonstrate a consistent, cohesive visual experience across Autodesk Vault Client, Web, and Mobile solutions.

## Themes

Switch between Dark, Light, and old Classic themes to reflect the visual alignment with other adjacent products from Autodesk. You can select the color theme under the Vault Options settings. By default, the light color theme is used. For more information, see [Configure Vault Options](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-18A5B6A9-933C-46AF-9865-79A15C3ED6E5).

The user interface theme controls the color of the application icons, frame, background, property panels, and dialogs.

Note that the new updates to the interface are not yet available in all areas of Vault.

Note: UI theme is available only in Autodesk Vault Office and Vault Professional.

## Icon Refresh

Vault icons are updated and refreshed to complement the Dark/Light theme interface​.

**Parent page:** [2023 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023.htm)


##### Markups

# Markups

Use markup to add comments, information, and suggestions for design changes to the drawing file. Check out the latest updates to the markups.

![](../images/new-2023-markup-16-9.png)

Note: In Thin Client, you can only view the markups. You can't create or delete a markup.

**Markup Browsing Panel**

You can filter markups based on who created the markup and the creation date. You can view, rename, and delete the markup through the panel. You can also collapse/expand the panel window.

**Saving Markups**

You can save the markup as an image on your local machine or save it as data on the Vault. The markup saved as data is listed in the Markup Browsing Panel.

**Markup in ECO**

You can view markup within ECO using Autodesk Viewer, make changes to the markup, and save it as data in the Vault.

For more information, see [Markup](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-E2624D7F-772F-46F4-B0F6-876AB837E00D).

**Parent page:** [2023 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023.htm)


##### Client Enhancements

# Client Enhancements

Learn about the enhancements made to the column view in multiple dialogs and Inventor file view option in Vault.

## Column customization in multiple dialogs

Customize view functionality is added to adjust the view of the columns in several dialogs (Change State, Change Revision, Change Category, Pack and Go, Synchronize Properties, Undo Check Out). By making efficient use of properties and customizing your view, data management becomes much more tailored to your project.

![](../images/new-2023-customizecolumns.png)

* [A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/change-state-vault-show-title-in-lifecycle-window/idi-p/6399608)
* [A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/customize-fields-in-change-state-command/idi-p/9336882)
* [A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/erweiterung-der-spalten-des-dialogfensters-quot-status-andern/idi-p/9087614)
* [A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/show-none-compliance-flags-in-state-change-dialog-box/idi-p/6672164)
* [A Vault Ideas submission](https://forums.autodesk.com/t5/vault-ideas/customise-columns-in-change-state/idi-p/9441882)

For more information, see [Organize Columns](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-7900CFF8-8AA5-4BE9-9B6F-E397FD19B34C).

## Inventor file view option

A new option called "Always use Inventor Read-only​ mode" is added to Vault Options for viewing the Inventor files setting. This option is always available regardless of whether the DWF file is available or not.

![](../images/new-2023-inventorfileviewingsettings.png)

For more information, see [Configure Vault Options for the Vault Client](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-18A5B6A9-933C-46AF-9865-79A15C3ED6E5).

##### Administration Enhancements

# Administration Enhancements

Learn about the new capabilities and enhancements available for administration in this release.

## Lifecycle state colors

Lifecycle Definition settings is enhanced to allow color customization for indicating a lifecycle state. You can now easily identify lifecycle states by color across all clients and user interfaces.

![](../images/new-2023-lifecyclestatecolor-16-9.png)

## Design file restriction

As an administrator, you can define the list of design files not to be checked in when the "Enforce Restriction for Check In of Design Files" is turned on. You can add the file extensions to the user-defined list but can't remove the system default extensions.

With this restriction, the user can't add restricted files via Vault Client (drag-and-drop or "Add Files" feature). They can only add restricted files using the add-in client for corresponding CAD applications to retain and maintain file relationships.

![](../images/new-2023-filetyperestriction.png)

For more information, see [Manage File Restrictions](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-DA5304A2-B669-48F7-A7EA-1053E44F776F).

**Parent page:** [2023 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023.htm)


##### Vault Gateway

# Vault Gateway

Connect remotely to Vault with Vault Gateway.

In the Vault 2023 release, Vault Gateway was developed to provide secure remote access to users working remotely. As a result, remote users can create and manage design data in Vault and enjoy the same experience as in the office. In addition, Vault Gateway allows VPN-less access to vaulted data behind the firewall with no additional configurations required on the Vault Client.

**Expanded Collaboration**

Vault Gateway allows better collaboration with suppliers and 3rd party collaborators. There is no need to create domain accounts for these users and give them VPN access. Instead, administrators can create Vault or Autodesk ID accounts along with the Vault Gateway URL, and these users get complete access to the vaulted data.

For more information, see [Vault Gateway](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-725723AF-CCFD-48A2-8A20-C332B9A75608).

**Parent page:** [2023 Updates and Enhancements](VLT-UANDE-2023.htm)

# Subscription Benefits

Subscribing to Vault Professional offers many [benefits](https://www.autodesk.com/subscription), including the following:

## Shared Views

Use Shared Views to collaborate online with people you're working with. You can upload a shared view, which is a visual representation of your model or design, from within your Autodesk product. By sending a link to the share view to your collaborators, they can view, and comment on, the shared view in [Autodesk Viewer](https://viewer.autodesk.com/), without needing an Autodesk product.

Available in Vault Professional 2018.1 or later

## Autodesk Drive

[Autodesk Drive](https://www.autodesk.com/help-drive-about-enu) provides a secure location in the cloud for individuals and small teams to store, preview, and share model or design data. View data in Drive from any device with a browser.

Available in Vault Professional 2019.
