##### Resolve Invalid .PSG File

# Resolve Invalid .PSG File

Resolve errors with empty .psg files.

When opening a legacy .rvt file or when adding sheets of a new .rvt file to a legacy .psg file, you may get an error stating the following:*The specified XML file is invalid. Its scheme is not supported by the Plot command. Please select a valid plot list file.*

This error means that the .psg file is empty and has no XML in it. Follow these steps to fix the .psg file:

1. Open Vault Client.
2. Locate the PSG file that generated the error.
3. Click the Plot icon to open the Plot Manager.
4. In the Plot Manager dialog, choose the Vault location of the PSG file.
5. Click OK and close the Plot Manager dialog.
6. Refresh Vault to see that the new version of the PSG file is created.

The missing XML is now included.

**Parent page:** [Add Sheets to a Vault](GUID-B18B8B2D-DFA3-4ECE-A834-4AE99C15112F.htm)


#### Sync on Demand

# Sync on Demand

When working with Revit server files or Work shared central files the only way to add or update a file in Vault is through the Synchronize with Central command in Revit. There are several options that can be set for adding a new version of the file to the Vault. At any time, the Synchronize on Demand button can be used to initiate synchronization. By clicking the Synchronize on Demand button it will toggle from:

![](../images/icon-revitaddin-sync.png)

to:

![](../images/icon-revitaddin-noupdateonsync.png)

#### Restore a Revit Project File

# Restore a Revit Project File

A Revit project may be restored to any point in time for which a backup was created.

This process supports rolling backward and forward through the snapshots. It is also possible to open a snapshot for comparison without disrupting the project in process.

## Restore a Central Project File

1. Ensure all users are disconnected from the central file.
2. Log into Autodesk Vault Professional from the Vault ribbon in Revit.
3. Click Open from Vault on the Vault ribbon.
4. Select the version of the file to open from vault.
5. From the Revit Save As command, save the file as a Central file to the Network share location.
6. Close the file.
7. Click Open from Vault on the Vault ribbon again.
8. Select the file and select the latest version.
9. Select Ok.

The opened file should be a local copy of the central file.

## Restore a Revit Server Project File

1. If the file exists on the Revit Server, ensure that all users are disconnected from the Revit Server file and delete it from the Revit Server.
2. Log into Autodesk Vault Professional from the Vault ribbon in Revit.
3. Click Open from Vault on the Vault ribbon.
4. Select the version of the file to open from vault.
5. From the Revit Save As command, save the file to the Revit Server location.
6. Close the file.
7. Click Open from Vault on the Vault ribbon again.
8. Select the file and select the latest version.
9. Select Ok.

The file that opens should be a local copy of the Revit Server file.

**Parent page:** [Revit Vault Add-in](GUID-7109C619-6DE3-4725-A8B4-45459DC0C3B5.htm)


#### Select a Shared Parameters File in Vault

# Select a Shared Parameters File in Vault

Shared parameters are definitions of parameters that you can add to families or projects. Shared parameter definitions are stored in a .txt file independent of any family file or Revit project; this allows you to access the file from different families or projects. This file is referred to as the Shared Parameters file.

Note: Refer to the Revit help for more information on using a Shared Parameters file.

The Shared Parameters file can be stored in the Vault and activated from the Shared Parameters button on the Revit Vault ribbon.

Tip: Autodesk recommends creating a shared parameters folder in the vault. Since there may be multiple types of .txt files a user can browse to inside a vault, a shared parameters folder makes it easy for users to differentiate which .txt files are parameter files.

**Select a Shared Parameters File in a Vault**

1. Open a project file and select Shared Parameters on the Revit Vault Ribbon.

   ![](../images/icon-revit-sharedparameters.png)

   The currently active Shared Parameters file is shown at the bottom left of the Select Shared Parameter File dialog.

   ![](../images/dialog-revit-selectsharedparametersfile.png)
2. Select the .txt Shared Parameters file that you want to activate and slick Select.

   The latest version of the file is downloaded and set as the active Shared Parameters file.

   Note: Vault does not confirm the legitimacy of the shared parameters file, so if you select an invalid .txt file in the vault, it will still be activated as the Shared Parameters file.

**Parent page:** [Revit Vault Add-in](GUID-7109C619-6DE3-4725-A8B4-45459DC0C3B5.htm)


#### Properties and the Revit Vault Add-in

# Properties and the Revit Vault Add-in

When a Revit Project is checked into a vault, the Vault Server extracts the properties associated with the project, including custom properties created in Revit.

Note: Write-back support is not available for custom properties. Custom properties are treated as read-only.

## Mapping Properties

If you want users to be able to search and edit properties for Revit projects in Vault, the properties must be mapped to [user-defined properties (UDPs)](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-1EC10936-9D84-4179-AEE3-59DD1B3E003C) in the Vault client.

Important: Revit properties are extracted as text data types, even if they are dates, and cannot be mapped to date type UDPs. Custom UDPs should be created with a text data type before mapping to Revit properties.

Choose Revit Models as the Content Source Provider when mapping in the client.

Note: By default, the Author property is mapped to the Author (UDP).

**Parent page:** [Revit Vault Add-in](GUID-7109C619-6DE3-4725-A8B4-45459DC0C3B5.htm)


#### Exclude Uploading Revit Linked Files to Vault Server

# Exclude Uploading Revit Linked Files to Vault Server

You can exclude uploading of Revit linked files to the vault server by manually adding a property called "ExcludeLinkedFiles" and setting this property to True/False in the ApplicationPreferences.xml file.

To configure this setting:

1. Close any Revit application.
2. Open ApplicationPreferences.xml file in a text editor. (Typically found at "<C:\Users(username)\AppData\Roaming\Autodesk\Revit 20xx Vault Addin>")
3. Add the following line under the Category "ApplicationOptions" with the desired value (true/false).

   * <Category ID="ApplicationOptions">
   * <Property Name="ExcludeLinkedFiles" Value="True" />
   * </Category>
4. Relaunch the Revit application.

**Parent page:** [Revit Vault Add-in](GUID-7109C619-6DE3-4725-A8B4-45459DC0C3B5.htm)

##### Configure Sharing Options for Revit Vault Add-in

# Configure Sharing Options for Revit Vault Add-in

Configure your synchronization and visualization attachment options on the Sharing tab.

![](../images/dialog-revitoptions-sharingtab.png)

* **Vault Upload Options**

  Vault Upload options allow you to configure when a synchronized file is added to the vault.

  + **Always Upload on Synchronization with Central** – Every time a Synchronize with Central command is performed, a new version of the file is added to the vault.
  + **Upload Every # hours on Synchronization** – When a Synchronize with Central command is performed, if the version in the vault is older than the set number of hours, then a new version is added to the vault.
  + **No automatic upload on Synchronization** – When a Synchronize with Central command is performed, no upload occurs.
  + **Upload on Close** – A new file version is added to the vault whenever a file is closed and changes have been made to local file.
* **Visualization Attachment Options**

  Visualization Attachment Options control how Visualization files are created when files are added through the Vault add-in for Revit.

  + **Send to Job Server**–When a file is added to vault, a job is queued to an active job server.
  + **Create when adding files**-Each file generates a visualization file during the add process.

    Note: This option adds processing time to the add operation.
  + **Do not create**–No visualization files are generated when a file is added to the vault.
  + **Include linked files**–Ensures that any selected options list above also apply to linked files.
* **Add to Vault**

  Configure which types of files cannot be added to the vault in the Add to Vault section.

  + If a file extension is listed, that file type cannot be added to the vault with Add File or Add Folder commands.

    Clear the Filter by extension check box if you do not want to filter out files with the listed extensions. This allows you to keep the list, and turn the filter on and off as needed.

##### Configure Mapping Options for Revit Vault Add-in

# Configure Mapping Options for Revit Vault Add-in

Map any local, network, or Revit server folder to any Vault folder on the Mapping tab of the Vault Options dialog.

Note: You must be an administrator or configuration administrator to modify VaultOptionsSet permissions.

![](../images/dialog-revit-mappingtabsubupdate2014.png)

**Create a New Mapping**

1. Click Options on the Vault Ribbon tab to launch the Vault Options dialog.
2. Selecting the Mapping tab.
3. Click Add ![](../images/icon-revitvaultaddin-addmapping.png) to launch the Create Mapping wizard.
4. Select whether you want to map a local folder or Revit Server folder to a folder in Vault.
5. Enter the path for the folder or click the ellipses to browse for the folder location.

   Tip: If you want to map to a network shared folder (\), enter the beginning of the network path in the browse field (e.g., \\network879). This way, you do not have to manually navigate to the network directory which can be time-consuming, depending on the size of the network and speed of your connection.
6. If browsing, select the folder that you want to map.

   Note: If you choose to map to a Revit Server folder, the Next button is disabled until a valid folder is selected.
7. Click Next.

   The Create Mapping wizard validates the specified path.
8. On the Select the Vault folder screen of the Create Mapping wizard, enter the path or click the ellipses (...) to browse to the Vault folder to which you will map your file system or Revit Server folder.
9. Click next to validate the mapping.

   If the mapping is valid, a confirmation displays showing the new mapping configuration.

   If the mapping is not valid, an error message displays and the wizard displays the attempted settings. An error may occur if one or both of the folders being mapped are already part of an existing mapping configuration. Modify your mapping settings and click Next to validate the changes.
10. Click Finish to close the wizard.
11. Click OK on the Vault Options dialog to save your mapping changes.

    Important: If you do not click OK on the Vault Options dialog, your mapping changes are not saved.

**Edit a Mapping**

1. Click Options on the Vault Ribbon tab to launch the Vault Options dialog.
2. Selecting the Mapping tab.
3. Click Edit ![](../images/icon-revitvaultaddin-editmapping.png) to launch the Edit Mapping wizard.
4. If needed, modify the path of the folder being mapped on the Select folder to be mapped screen of the wizard.
5. Click Next.
6. If needed, modify the path of the Vault folder to which the file system or Revit Server folder is being mapped.
7. Click next to validate the mapping.

   If the mapping is valid, a confirmation displays showing the new mapping configuration.

   If the mapping is not valid, an error message displays and the wizard displays the attempted settings. An error may occur if one or both of the folders being mapped are already part of an existing mapping configuration. Modify your mapping settings and click Next to validate the changes.
8. Click Finish to close the wizard.
9. Click OK on the Vault Options dialog to save your mapping changes.

   Important: If you do not click OK on the Vault Options dialog, your mapping changes are not saved.

**Delete a Mapping**

1. Click Options on the Vault Ribbon tab to launch the Vault Options dialog.
2. Selecting the Mapping tab.
3. Select a mapping in the Mapping grid and click Delete ![](../images/icon-revitvaultaddin-deletemapping.png).
4. Click Yes on the verification prompt to confirm that the mapping should be deleted.
5. Click OK on the Vault Options dialog to save your mapping changes.

Important: If you do not click OK on the Vault Options dialog, your mapping changes are not saved.

**Reorder Mappings**

Mappings are listed in order of priority.

1. Click Options on the Vault Ribbon tab to launch the Vault Options dialog.
2. Selecting the Mapping tab.
3. Select one or more mappings and use the Move arrows ![](../images/icon-revitvaultaddin-reordermapping.png) to arrange the mapping in the preferred order.
4. Click OK on the Vault Options dialog to save your mapping changes.

Important: If you do not click OK on the Vault Options dialog, your mapping changes are not saved.

##### Configure the Share Path for the Revit Vault Add-in

# Configure the Share Path for the Revit Vault Add-in

Share Path is a vault property that may be added to a vault folder. This property provides vault with the location of the Revit central project files on your network.

The advantage of using the Share Path is that the Revit add-in will duplicate the folder structure of the network share inside vault. Having the Share Path configured also removes the need for users to select the vault folder while adding files to the vault.

By configuring Share Path, the folder structure on the network share is duplicated automatically in the vault as files are added.

Note: Sharepath is only need for Add Files and Add Folder commands. All other Revit commands use the mapped folders defined in the Mapping options.

1. Log in to the Autodesk Vault Professional stand-alone client.
2. Select or create a vault folder that contains the project folders.
3. Go to the Edit menu and select Edit Properties.
4. On the Property Edit dialog click Select Properties.
5. On the Customize Fields dialog, set the Select available fields from value to Folders.
6. Select Share Path on the left side of the dialog, click Add -> to move SharePath to the right side.
7. Click OK to close the dialog.
8. On the Property Edit dialog, enter the path to the network share location of the Revit project folders in the Share Path field.
9. Click OK to close the Property Edit dialog.
10. Review the Property Edit Results and click OK if everything is accurate.
11. Open a local copy of a Revit project that has its central file in the network share path that you just added to the vault.
12. Log into vault from Revit.
13. When the next Revit Synchronize with Central is performed, a new version of the file is added to the vault.

Note:

When using Revit Server, the Sharepath value should match the value in the RSN.ini file for the Revit server being mapped. For example if the server's IP address is 10.1.1.10 then the value for the Share path should be RSN://10.1.1.10.

##### Configure Searching Options for Revit Vault Add-in

# Configure Searching Options for Revit Vault Add-in

You can control which categories and parameters are displayed in searches in the left pane of the Load Family dialog by configuring the settings on the Searching tab of the Vault Options dialog.

For example, you can determine the types of parameters that show up for the category Doors, and whether you want Balusters and Callout Heads displayed as categories.

Note: You must be an administrator to modify the settings on the Searching tab.

![](../images/dialog-revitsearch-vaultoptions-searching.png)

Important: The Revit Indexing Service must be enabled to search family types. See [Install the Vault Server](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-BAE65F60-3486-47C7-A0C6-2C6191862F15) for more information.

**Configure Searching Options**

Note: You must ben an administrator to modify the settings on the Searching tab.

1. Click Options on the Vault add-in ribbon.
2. Select the Search tab on the Vault Options dialog.

   A list of all indexed Categories in the Vault is displayed.
3. Select the check box for any categories you want to show up in the Family Search.

   By default, all categories are selected.
4. Select a Category to modify its parameters.
5. Select the check box for each parameter that you want displayed in the Parameters list when searching this category.
6. Click OK to save your changes.

**Fast-Pick Options for Category Parameters**

Note: You must be an administrator to modify the settings on the Searching tab.

You can manually select the parameters that you want to show up in searches, or you can select them all for a category, unselect them all for a category, or select a certain parameter across all categories by using the context menu.

![](../images/menu-revitsearchoptions-right-click.png)

1. Click Options on the Vault add-in ribbon.
2. Select the Search tab on the Vault Options dialog.

   A list of all indexed Categories in the Vault is displayed.
3. Select a category.
4. Perform one of the following tasks:

   * Right-click anywhere in the list of parameters and choose Select all to select all parameters for that category.
   * Right-click anywhere in the list of parameters and choose Clear all to deselect all parameters for that category.
   * Select a particular parameter, right-click and select Show parameter to select that parameter.
   * Select a particular parameter, right-click and select Hide parameter to deselect that parameter.
   * Select a particular parameter, right-click and select Show in all categories to select that parameter across all categories.
   * Select a particular parameter, right-click and select Hide in all categories to deselect that parameter across all categories.
   * Right-click anywhere in the Searching tab and select Restore all to default to reset all parameters to their original product settings.
5. Click OK to save your changes.

### Vault Office

# Vault Office

Autodesk Vault Office is a separate product available for purchase, which provides basic vaulting capabilities for non-CAD users. Autodesk Vault Office delivers single document check-in and checkout via the Vault mobile app and the add-in, allowing you to manage all of your office data, including word documents, spreadsheets, and presentations.

Using Autodesk Vault Office, you can organize all of your files and keep them in one location for easy access. All file versions are retained, so you never misplace or replace past versions. The vault stores each version of a file, along with any file dependencies, giving you a living history of the project as you work on it. The vault also stores file properties, such as the user name, date, and comments, for rapid searching and retrieving.

Once Autodesk Vault Office is installed, a new ribbon tab and menu items are added to the Office application.

Note: Refer to [Install the Vault Add-in for Microsoft Office](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-508F607E-BEFA-4E79-82B5-6A1BBFBD3DBC) for more information.

#### Map Folders with the Outlook Vault Add-in

# Map Folders with the Outlook Vault Add-in

When you map the Outlook folder to a Vault folder, new email items that are checked into the vault are automatically stored in the corresponding vault folder. You can create new mappings and remove existing mapping on the Outlook Folder Mapping dialog.

## Learn about the Outlook Folder Mapping Dialog

You can perform the following tasks on the Outlook Folder Mapping dialog:

* Click Add to open the Select Folder dialog and specify your folder mapping preferences.
* Click Remove to remove an existing mapping.
* Click OK to exit the dialog and apply the changes.
* Click Cancel to exit the dialog without applying the changes.

There are two options on the Outlook Folder Mapping dialog to help you streamline your work environment,

* Show check in dialog once item is received in Outlook folder–When selected, the Check-in dialog appears whenever a new email item is received . If unselected, the email items are checked into the Vault automatically.

  Note: The default option of "Show check in dialog once item is received in Outlook folder" is unchecked.
* Show prompt message once item been removed from Outlook folder–When selected, a message box appears with the reminder that "A mail item has been removed in Outlook. Please remove it from the Vault manually." If unselected, no message appears when deleting or removing an email item from an Outlook folder.

  Note: The default option of "Show prompt message once item been removed from Outlook folder" is checked.

## Add a New Folder Mapping

1. Click Add on the Outlook Folder Mapping dialog .
2. Select an Outlook folder and click "OK." The "New" button will create a new outlook folder.
3. Select an existing location from the list of vault folders or click Add Folder to create a new vault folder, and then click OK.
4. Click OK on the "Outlook Folder Mapping" dialog to save the changes.

Note: If you map a calendar folder to a Vault folder, when you accept or decline the request you may be notified that a mail item has been removed in Outlook, and that it should be removed from the Vault.

#### Configure Property Extraction for the Outlook Vault Add-in

# Configure Property Extraction for the Outlook Vault Add-in

In order to build a conversation structure that can be seen in the "Used" tab when the mapping has been done, the administrator can press the "Settings" Button to invoke a dialog where the two user-defined properties have to be selected. After pressing "OK" these properties are set to a Vault Option and will be used by all clients, connected to that Vault.

Note: Only users with administrative privileges can see the Settings button.

## Configuration

1. Before you use the Autodesk Vault Add-In , a user with administrative privileges has to create two properties in Vault and map them to the Outlook properties " Item name " and "Sent Date ". Please refer to '*Preconditions for Settings*' in the below section .

#### Configure Email Conversation Settings for the Outlook Vault Add-in

# Configure Email Conversation Settings for the Outlook Vault Add-in

Administrators can configure email conversations so that they are visible on the Used tab in the Vault client.

Note: You must be an administrator to see and access the Settings button in the Outlook Vault add-in.

These conversations can be configured based on properties for the specific conversation topic and properties for sorting.

Configure Email Conversation Settings

1. Before you use the Add-in, an administrator must create two properties in Vault and map them to the Outlook properties Item Name and Sent Date.

   See [Configure User-Defined Properties](https://beehive.autodesk.com/community/service/rest/cloudhelp/resource/cloudhelpchannel/guidcrossbook/?p=VAULT&l=ENU&accessmode=live&v=2026&guid=GUID-1EC10936-9D84-4179-AEE3-59DD1B3E003C) and Configure the [Outlook Vault Add-in for Property Extraction](GUID-7D5AB2B2-65FE-4597-B1CC-1C81F1EAA583.htm) for more information.
2. When the properties have been created and mapped, open the Outlook Vault Add-in and click Settings on the Autodesk Vault ribbon.

   Note: You must be an administrator to see and access the Settings button in the Outlook Vault add-in.
3. On the Email Conversation Settings dialog, specify the property you want Vault to monitor for conversation topic.
4. Select how you want the conversations based on that topic sorted.
5. Click OK.

## Autoloader

# Autoloader

Autodesk Autoloader bulk uploads data to a vault.

Autoloader does not affect the original source files. The source files are copied to a temporary location on the local computer before being uploaded. If you are uploading Autodesk Inventor files, once any file resolution issues have been addressed and the copied files have been organized for use with a vault, they are then uploaded to the vault.

## System Requirements

* Autodesk Vault
* Autodesk Data Management Server Console
* If you use the default Microsoft SQL Server Express to manage your vault, make sure the total amount of data in your vault after upload is less than 10 gigabytes or 50,000 versions. If your vault data will exceed these specifications, upgrade to full Microsoft SQL Server before installing Autoloader and uploading your data.

## Supported Data Formats

* Autoloader supports Inventor R10 and newer data.
* Autoloader supports AutoCAD R14 (and AutoCAD R14 products) and newer data.
* Autoloader supports MicroStation DGN files.

## Upload Recommendations

Follow these guidelines for autoloading data into the vault:

* Close as many applications as possible while autoloading data.
* Autoloader copies all files to be uploaded to a temporary folder on the system that is running Autoloader. Therefore, enough free space must be available to accommodate the duplication of the files. If you are publishing DWF or DWFX files, enough space must also be available to accommodate the visualization files as well.
* If you are autoloading Inventor files and not publishing DWF files, upload in batches no greater than 30,000 files.
* If you are autoloading Inventor files and publishing DWF files, upload in batches no greater than 20,000 files.
* If you are autoloading AutoCAD or DWG files without publishing DWF, upload in batches no greater than 50,000 files.
* If you are autoloading AutoCAD or DWG files and publishing DWF, upload in batches no greater than 30,000 files.

## Replicated Environment Requirements

If you are using Autoloader in a replicated environment, you must meet the following requirements to be able to upload data to a vault using Autoloader.

* You must have administrator privileges for the vault.

## Multiple Instances of Autoloader

Users can run more than one instance of Autoloader on separate workstations while logged into the vault at the same time. Once the administrator runs Autoloader on the server and customizes the Design and Library folder names, additional instances of Autoloader can run concurrently. Users are responsible for ensuring that the datasets uploaded do not overlap.

## Before using Autoloader

* Autodesk strongly recommends that you fully back up all vaults before autoloading data.
* In order to use Autoloader, you must disable Enforce Unique File Names in the Vault.
* The Upload Report generated after files have been uploaded can only be viewed on the machine that created the report.
* A Vault product must also be installed on the same system as Autoloader.
* DWF publishing is not supported when autoloading Inventor data with Inventor LT.
* AutoCAD files with model documentation drawing views of Inventor references are not supported with Autoloader.
* If Inventor needs to re-register with the operating system while Autoloader is running, Inventor's re-registration process may cause Autoloader to close. Be sure to save all Scan and Upload reports before starting Inventor with Autoloader running.
* In order to publish visualization files (DWF or DWFx) for Inventor iParts, Autoloader requires that Microsoft Office Excel is installed.
* It is required that all Inventor files be uploaded into the same folder in the vault. The default name of this folder is Designs but you may rename it. However, you may not rename the Designs folder after you have already uploaded files into it.
* If Direct 3D 9 is installed on your machine, it is recommended that you change the Inventor hardware setting to any value other than Direct 3D before doing DWF or DWFX publishing in Autoloader.
* AutoCAD file types may be uploaded to any folder in the vault.
* AutoCAD Electrical files, AutoCAD Mechanical files, and Mechanical Desktop files will all be uploaded to the vault as vanilla AutoCAD files. This may result in the loss of file relationships.
* Sheet Set Data will be uploaded to the vault as vanilla AutoCAD files. This may result in the loss of sheet set relationships. It is recommended that you use Sheet Set Manager to check in sheet set data.

### Autoloader–Select Data Source

# Autoloader–Select Data Source

Specify a folder to upload to a vault on the Select Data Source screen.

1. Click Select Folder.
2. In the Browse for Folder dialog, locate and select the folder containing the data to add to the vault, and then click OK.

   If the selected folder contains an Inventor file, Autoloader searches for all possible .ipj files. If multiple .ipj files are found, the Select Project dialog is displayed and you are prompted to select the .ipj file corresponding to the data you want to upload. If the project file is not listed, click Browse and then locate the .ipj file. Once the correct .ipj has been selected, click OK.

   Note: Only one folder can be uploaded at a time. If a folder has already been selected as a data source, you are prompted to decide whether or not the new folder replaces the existing folder as the data source.
3. The Select Data Source screen displays the folder structure of the selected project as well as the associated files. Files and folders can be selectively excluded from list of source files to be uploaded. The actual data is not impacted by Autoloader. Excluding either a file or a folder from the data source list only removes the item from the list. The actual files are not deleted.

   * To exclude a folder in the data source from being uploaded, select the folder and then click Exclude from Upload in the tool bar or right-click the folder and then select Exclude from Upload. You are prompted to verify removing the selected folder and its contents. Click Yes to remove the folder from the list. This prevents the folder from being uploaded to the vault. It does not affect the actual source data.
   * To exclude a file in the data source from being uploaded, select a file from the list on the right and then click Exclude from Upload in the tool bar or right-click the file and then select Exclude from Upload. You are prompted to verify removing the selected file. Click Yes to remove the file from the list. This prevents the file from being uploaded to the vault. It does not affect the actual source data.
4. Once you have selected a folder to upload and you have excluded any unnecessary files from the list, click Next.

### Autoloader–Duplicate Management

# Autoloader–Duplicate Management

After a folder has been selected as a data source, Autoloader can scan the data for duplicate files.

The duplicate files are displayed in the Duplicate Files tab at the bottom of the screen and any duplicate files with errors display in the Dependencies tab. Duplicates can then be archived by selecting the Archives button.

1. On the Data Scan and Report dialog, click the drop-down arrow next to the Scan button and select Find Duplicates. All checked files will be examined for duplication.
2. Any duplicates are displayed in the Duplicate Files tab at the bottom of the dialog box.

   The Archive button is enabled if duplicates are found.
3. In the Duplicate Files tab, select the check box beside the files that you want to archive.
4. Click the Archives button to save the selected files in the folder specified in the Folder Locations section of the Preferences dialog. Archived files will now show an archived status.

[Previous Step](GUID-67B9ED0F-BCEC-47F0-A4A9-85D9A87B291F.htm) | [Next Step](GUID-C0156404-98AB-4C70-9CD0-45FDD0A2C084.htm)

**Parent page:** [Autoloader](GUID-EA9B2552-30B9-4789-9A5E-6580B8648981.htm)


### Autoloader–Scan Data

# Autoloader–Scan Data

After a folder has been selected as the data source, Autoloader scans the data to verify that all the file relationships resolve properly.

The files are scanned and a report is displayed in the Dependencies tab at the bottom of the screen indicating the files that contain unresolved references or are missing altogether. If any files fail to resolve, either open the file's parents in the associated CAD application and correct the problem or exclude the files and their parent files from being uploaded. You can fix the files without closing Autoloader and then re-scan any files that have been corrected. See the CAD application's help for more information on correcting missing references.

Note: You cannot proceed with the upload process until all of the files have been scanned and any resolution issues have been corrected. If you resolve file issues outside of Autoloader, click Scan again to process the files that have been fixed.

1. The files listed are all the files that were selected as the data source. All of the files must be scanned. You can incrementally scan groups of files using the file type filter or by using the check boxes to indicate which files to include in the scan.

   You can filter the list to show file types, based on your version of Autoloader.

   **Autoloader**

   * All File Types
   * All Autodesk Inventor Part Files (.ipt)
   * All Autodesk Inventor Assembly Files (.iam)
   * All Autodesk Inventor Presentation Files (.ipn)
   * All Autodesk Inventor Drawing Files (.idw,.dwg)
   * AutoCAD Files (.dwg, .dws, .dwt, .dxf, .dgn)

   **Autoloader for Pro/ENGINEER**

   * All File Types
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Assembly files (.asm)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Drawing files (.drw)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Form files (.frm)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Mfg files (.mfg)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Part files (.prt)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Symbol files (.sym)

   To filter the file list by file type, select a file type from the drop-down list.

   To skip a file during the scanning process, turn off the corresponding check box. The unchecked files are skipped during that scan. The skipped files must be scanned later before you can progress through Autoloader.

   To remove files from the list, select a file or files and then click Remove. You are prompted that the removed files may be added to the list again during the scanning process if they are related to other files that remain in the list. Click Yes to remove the selected files. Click No to keep the files in the list.

   To view a file, right-click on a file and select Open from the context menu. The file will launch in the appropriate application. If the correct application cannot be found, you will be prompted to select one from the web or from the list of installed programs.
2. Click Scan to validate the checked files.

   If a Find Duplicates process was previously run, click the drop-down arrow next to the Find Duplicates button and select Scan.

   Note: Click Stop at any time during a scan to halt the scan process.
3. The results of the scan indicate which files passed and which files require attention. To view the results of the scan, click >> to expand the dialog box.

   Click Export to save the results as an Excel file (.xls), as a comma separated values file (.csv), or an extensible markup language file (.xml). By default, the file is saved at the Data Analysis Report Folder location indicated. To change the location of the file, click Preferences and select a new location for the Scan Analysis Report Folder field. Use this list as a guide for correcting file issues, if necessary.
4. Once all the files have been scanned and all of the files resolve properly, click Next.

### Autoloader–Log In and Out of a Vault

# Autoloader–Log In and Out of a Vault

After your files are scanned, you must log into a vault before you can map any folders.

Contact the administrator of your vault for your account information and server location. If an account has not been set up for you, contact your vault administrator.

## Log into a Vault

1. Enter the user name and password assigned to you by your vault administrator.

   Note: If the administrator has enforced a password policy and your current password does not meet the requirements, you will receive a prompt to change your Vault account password.
2. Enter the name of the computer where the server is installed, for example, SERVERNAME. If you do not know the name of the server, contact your administrator.
3. Enter the name of the database to which you have access. The names of the last several databases that have been accessed are retained in the drop-down list. You can select the name of the database from the list or click the expansion button to see the complete list of previously accessed databases. If you do not know the name of the database, contact your administrator.
4. **Autoloader for Pro/ENGINEER Users Only**–select a workspace.
5. If you have a Microsoft Windows Active Directory account, you can log into the Autodesk Data Management Server using your Microsoft Windows user account credentials. Turn on the Windows Authentication check box.

   * Windows Authentication is available only for Active Directory domains.
   * If you are not using Windows Authentication, then you must have a valid Autodesk Data Management Server account.
   * This option is not available for Autodesk Vault .

     Note: If Windows Authentication is turned on, the User Name field displays the domain name combined with the Windows user name. Neither the user name nor the password can be changed.
6. Select the Automatically login next session check box to sign in automatically next time.
7. Click OK.

## Log Out of a Vault

* On the Map Vault Folders dialog, click the Login Information icon at anytime to log out of the vault. You will not be able to map vault folders if you are logged out. Click the Login Information icon again to log back in.

### Autoloader–Map Vault Folders

# Autoloader–Map Vault Folders

After the files have been scanned, you must map the file folder structure to a folder structure or search path in vault.

Your data is never directly impacted by the actions of Autoloader.

The Resultant Vault View shows the folder structure of the vault.

If you are uploading an Autodesk Inventor project, the workspace, libraries, and content center library in the project need to be mapped to folders in the vault. The workspace folder can be mapped directly to the Designs folder in the vault or to any subfolder in the Designs folder. Libraries can be mapped directly to the Libraries folder in the vault or to any subfolder in the Libraries folder. However, Content Libraries are automatically mapped to the vault Content Center Files folder.

1. If the target folder for the workspace does not exist in the vault yet, right-click the Designs folder in the Resultant Vault View and then select New Folder. In the Create Folder dialog box, enter a name for the new folder and then click OK.

   If the library folder does not exist in the vault yet, right-click the Libraries folder in the Resultant Vault View and then select New Library Folder. In the Create Folder dialog box, enter a name for the new library folder and then click OK.
2. In the Target Location in Vault column associated with the folder to check in, click the browse button.
3. In the Browse Vault for Folder dialog box, select either the Designs folder or a subfolder to be mapped to the workspace for the project. This will create a subfolder called Designs under the Design folder. To map the workspace folder directly to the Designs folder without creating a subfolder, select the Direct Mapping check box.
4. Click OK. If the vault folder doesn't exist, click New Folder and create a new folder in the vault.
5. If libraries are being added to the vault, in the Target Location in Vault column associated with the library folder to check in, click the browse button.
6. In the Browse Vault for Folder dialog box, select either the Libraries folder or a subfolder to be mapped to the libraries for the project and then click OK. If the vault folder doesn't exist, click New Folder and create a new folder in the vault.
7. You can rename or delete any new folder created in the vault view. Select the folder and then click Rename to change the name of the new folder. Select the folder and then click Delete to remove the new folder.
8. The files from the data source will be copied to a temporary folder prior to being uploaded to the vault. The temporary folder location is displayed at the bottom of the screen. To change the temporary folder location, click Browse to select a different folder or create a new one and then click OK.
9. Click Next.

### Autoloader–Specify Data Subsets

# Autoloader–Specify Data Subsets

The Specify Data Subsets screen lists all the files that will be uploaded to the vault. You can choose to upload the entire file set, or specify unique subsets to be uploaded. You can also apply pre-defined file filters to the data source to upload clean subsets of the source data.

1. By default, all of the data will be uploaded to the vault. To upload only a specific file type, select a file type from the Data Filters list. Data filters depend on which version of Autoloader you are running:

   **Autoloader**

   * All Inventor data
   * Assembly files and dependencies
   * Drawing files and dependencies
   * Presentation files and dependencies
   * Library files
   * Standard Content (Content Center)
   * Only Part files and dependencies
   * All AutoCAD Data
   * All Data

   **Autoloader for Pro/ENGINEER**

   * All Pro/ENGINEER Assembly files (.asm)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Drawing files (.drw)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Form files (.frm)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Mfg files (.mfg)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Part files (.prt)
   * All Pro/ENGINEER Symbol files (.sym)
2. Turn on the Create Visualization Attachment check box to create and attach visualization files to all the CAD files that are uploaded to the vault. If Create Visualization Attachment is enabled, it is recommended that large file uploads are performed in subsets by file type.

   If the Job Server is enabled in the Autodesk Vault client, select one of the following options:

   * Select the Immediately option to publish the visualization file locally.
   * Select the Using the Job server option to send the file to the Job Server for publishing.

     Note: See the Autodesk Vault client help for more information on managing the Job Server.
3. Click Upload. The upload process begins and the progress is displayed. When the upload has completed, click View Report to see a summary of the upload.

### Autoloader–View the Upload Progress

# Autoloader–View the Upload Progress

The Autoload Progress and Report screen displays the progress of the upload process.

The report lists the files that successfully uploaded to the vault as well as any files that did not upload. The full upload status report is saved at the location indicated at the bottom of the screen. The report is stored as an .xml file.

1. Click View Report to display the entire report in new window.

   The results of the upload process are summarized in the Autoloader Report.
2. Click Done.
3. Launch the Autodesk Vault client and verify that the data is now stored in the vault.
4. If you are performing incremental uploads, return the Specify Data Subsets screen, select the next set of files, and then click Upload.
5. If you have another project to upload to the vault, start the Autoloader again and repeat the process.

### Autoloader–Review the Results

# Autoloader–Review the Results

The report lists the files that were uploaded successfully to the vault, the files that failed to upload, and the files that were skipped. The report also shows the total amount of time that the upload required.

1. Click Print to send the report to a printer.
2. Click Done.

4. If you are performing incremental uploads, return to the Specify Data Subsets screen, select the next set of files, and then click Upload.
5. If you have another folder to upload to the vault, start the Autoloader again and repeat the process.

### Autoloader: Configure User Preferences

# Autoloader: Configure User Preferences

Customize the Autoloader user settings on the Preferences dialog.

These settings are designed for advanced users of Autoloader and are divided into three sections: Duplicate File Management, Scan Options, and Folder Locations. All settings are retained for subsequent Autoloader sessions.

**Duplicate File Management**

Indicate your preferences for finding duplicates during a scan based on certain file attributes or determine whether an archive report of duplicates is generated in this section.

**Autoloader for Pro/ENGINEER users** can also search on duplicate file iterations.

**Scan Options**

Specify a threshold for the number of files scanned in this section. When a scan is generated, a notification displays informing the user if the threshold is met or exceeded. The user can then decide whether to continue the scan or end it.

**DWF Options**

If you are creating DWF attachments, configure the quality here to minimum, medium, or maximum quality.

**Folder Locations**

Specify the default folder locations for scan analysis reports, upload reports, and archives in this section.

## Configure User Preferences

1. Click the Preferences icon to display the Preferences dialog.
2. Select the Find duplicate files during Scan check box to locate duplicate files during a scan session.
3. Click the Settings button to select the file attributes for which the scan searches for duplicates.

   On the Settings dialog select which file and date and time stamp attributes by which you'd like to scan for duplicates. Click OK to save the changes. If you want to ignore library and content center files when scanning for duplicates, select the Ignore Libraries and Content Center Files check box.
4. On the Preferences dialog, select the Generate archive report check box to create an archive report of duplicates found during a scan.
5. Select the Notify if file count exceeds check box and enter the file limit at which a scan will halt if it meets or exceeds. The notify threshold must range from 1 to 999,999.
6. Enter the default folder locations for scan analysis reports, upload reports, and archives in the Folder Locations section, or click the browse button to navigate to the appropriate directory.
7. Click Close to save the settings and close the Preferences dialog.

### Troubleshooting: Data Management Services

# Troubleshooting: Data Management Services

This topic includes links to information that can assist in working through an issue.

## Issue

When trying to connect and log into a Vault Server, the following error is displayed:

"<Productname>...could not find the Data Management Services on...<servername>"

The error message can be displayed using Internet Information Server (IIS) Server Certificate (SSL), or using the following software:

* Vault Basic
* Vault Professional
* Inventor, AutoCAD, Revit, Civil 3D, Plant 3D, ...or any other CAD addin.
* Word, Excel, PowerPoint
* Autodesk Data Management Server Console

### Solution

The error may appear if a major Windows Update on the Vault Server has recently occurred.

Repair the installation of Vault Server using the instructions in the article [Repairing, Uninstalling and Reinstalling the Vault Server software](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Uninstalling-and-reinstalling-the-Vault-Server.html).

If a repair of Vault Server does not resolve the issue, or only one user is affected, use the troubleshooting steps in the article [Troubleshooting Autodesk Vault Client to Server Connectivity issues](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Troubleshooting-Autodesk-Vault-Client-to-Server-Connectivity-issues.html).

**Parent page:** [Troubleshooting Errors and Messages](GEN-TROUBLESHOOTING-ERRORS.htm)


### Troubleshooting: Incompatibility Errors

# Troubleshooting: Incompatibility Errors

This topic includes links to information that can assist in working through an issue.

## Issue

While logging into the Vault Server, the following error message appears:

"<Vault Client Edition Year> is not compatible with the following applications on <VAULTSERVERNAME or VAULTIPADDRESS>"

...

The message may appear using:

* Vault Thick Client
* CAD Integration
* Thin Client

### Solution

1. Check if the Vault Client and Server are installed in environments supported by the software. See [Vault System Requirements](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/System-requirements-for-Autodesk-Vault-products.html).
2. Check disk space on the Vault Server and restart the Vault Server.
3. Check the Vault version.

   * Ensure that the Vault Client version being used is not higher than the Vault Server. See [Vault Client and Server compatibility with older releases](https://help.autodesk.com/view/VAULT/2026/ENU/?guid=GUID-334CC890-1F12-429C-9D6A-B964327CA590).
   * If the error is occurring when connecting to the Thin Client, make sure that the same version of the Thin Client is installed on the server, and that any previous version of the Thin Client is removed.
   * To resolve the inconvenience, uninstall newer version from client computer, install the same version/edition as Vault server or upgrade the Vault server to same version as client.
   * This error can occur if no Vault licenses are available. Regenerate the new license, and configure the license server to use the new license. See [How to download Vault Server, Client and AVFS from Autodesk Accounts](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/How-to-download-Vault-Server-in-Autodesk-Accounts.html).
4. Check the Vault edition.

   The Vault Client is not running the same edition of Vault (basic-or-professional) as the Vault Server.

   * A Vault Basic Client cannot connect to a Vault Professional Server.
   * A Vault Professional Client cannot connect to a Vault Basic Server.
5. The wrong Vault integration is registered with the CAD software.

   It is possible that the wrong version of the Vault integration is registered with the CAD client.

   If both Vault Basic and Vault Professional clients are installed, and unable to connect to the Vault Professional Server, it's possible that the Vault Basic integration is registered with the CAD software and taking priority. In that instance, uninstall\reinstall the Vault Professional CAD Integration. See [Uninstalling and reinstalling the Vault Integration](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Uninstalling-and-reinstalling-the-Vault-Integration.html).
6. The Vault client has become corrupt. See [Uninstalling and reinstalling the Vault Client](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Uninstalling-and-reinstalling-the-Vault-Client.html).
7. Restart Internet Information Services (IIS).

   The Windows World Wide Web service that Autodesk Vault Server uses can sometimes refuse more client connections when it runs out of memory. This can be easily rectified by restarting IIS. See [How to restart Vault servers "World Wide Web Publishing Service"](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/How-to-configure-Vault-servers-World-Wide-Web-Publishing-Service-to-automatically-restart-after-it-fails.html).
8. Ensure that all the services that Autodesk Vault Server uses are running (IIS, SQL, and the Autodesk Job Dispatch Service).

   Check that no Windows Updates are pending on the Vault server as often SQL server updates cause the server to stop. See [Are Vault Servers critical services running?](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Are-Vault-Servers-critical-services-running.html)

   Note: It might be necessary to restart the Vault Server.
9. Ensure that the Vault Servers Web Service is configured correctly.

   If a configuration change in Internet Information Services (IIS) has recently been implemented, roll back that change. See [How to check if Vaults Servers, Web Service is configured correctly](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/How-to-check-if-Vaults-Servers-Web-Service-is-configured-correctly.html).
10. Install the latest updates on the Vault Server and the Client/CAD Software. Choose the product you’re using from the links below to find the updates you need.

    * [Vault Downloads](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/product/vault-products)
    * [Inventor Downloads](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/product/inventor)
    * [AutoCAD Downloads](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/product/autocad)
11. Check that the permissions are unmodified on the folder Vault Server uses to write to the log files.

    Autodesk Vault does not support changes to the permissions on the log file folder. The quickest solution to this is to uninstall and reinstall the Vault Server software. See [Uninstalling and reinstalling the Vault Server](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Uninstalling-and-reinstalling-the-Vault-Server.html).
12. Proxy Server interfering with Vault.

    * See [Configure Vault to Use a Proxy Server](https://help.autodesk.com/view/VAULT/2026/ENU/?guid=GUID-3BA3F33B-C0BD-47B1-9DBC-3D9DB9A21ABB).
    * See [How to bypass a Proxy Server using the Application .config file for a Vault client or integration](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Vault-Bypassing-a-Proxy-using-the-Application-config-file.html).
13. Windows Authentication is disabled on AutodeskDM virtual directory on IIS.

    Enable Windows Authentication in IIS Management. See [How To Enable Windows Authentication on Windows Server, AFTER installing Vault Server](https://www.autodesk.com/support/technical/article/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/How-To-Enable-Windows-Authentication-on-Windows-Server-AFTER-installing-Vault-Server.html).
14. Windows Server role "Windows Server Update Service" is uninstalled:

    * .NET and IIS roles were removed.
    * Reinstall the "Windows Server Update Service". See [Windows Server Update Services (WSUS)](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-server-update-services/get-started/windows-server-update-services-wsus).
    * After reinstalling, the "Windows Server Update Service" can be disabled in windows services.
15. DNS (Domain Name Service) problems are preventing computer names from being resolved to IP addresses.

    * Try connecting to the Vault Server using the IP Address instead of the hostname.
    * Run the command ipconfig /flushdns from the Command prompt of the client.
    * Edit the clients hosts files:

      + Navigate to C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc on the client machine.
      + Edit the "hosts" file with Notepad and map the server hostname to it's IP address.

**Parent page:** [Troubleshooting Errors and Messages](GEN-TROUBLESHOOTING-ERRORS.htm)

### Troubleshooting: Dialogs not on Current Screen

# Troubleshooting: Dialogs not on Current Screen

## Issue

Users with varying monitor setups may experience difficulties with dialog boxes. These dialogs (checkout, copy design, errors, etc.) may not display on the primary screen, particularly when transitioning between multi-screen systems and a single laptop. This issue arises because it persist the last location of the dialog box, even if it's off-screen in the current monitor setup.

### Solution

To resolve this issue, command line utility can be used to reset the dialog locations.

1. Close the Autodesk Vault client.
2. Run the command line utility.

**Note:** If the client is running and the utility is run, a warning will be displayed to close the client first.

The command line utility has two options:

1. **Reset the dialog locations:** This option deletes the information or XML files which store dialog location settings, keeping everything else as is.

   `C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Vault Client {release}\Explorer\Connectivity.VaultPro.exe ResetDialogLocations`
2. **Reset Vault Client profile:** This option deletes all XML files related to Vault client.

   `C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Vault Client {release}\Explorer\Connectivity.VaultPro.exe ResetAllClientSettings`

**Parent page:** [Troubleshooting Errors and Messages](GEN-TROUBLESHOOTING-ERRORS.htm)

##### File Administration Settings

# File Administration Settings

The Files tab on the Vault Settings dialog contains options for enforcing unique file names, disabling design file check in, specifying working folder options, and locating duplicates.

Note: In Autodesk Vault Basic, you can create and modify properties on the Files tab as well.

## Access the Files tab on the Vault Settings dialog.

1. Click Tools > Administration > Vault Settings.
2. Select the **Files** tab.

![](../images/vaultsettings-fileadministration.png)

### File Options

* Click Define to enforce unique identifying name for files in the vault. Use Find Duplicate Names to locate duplicate file names in the vault to help resolve any file name conflicts before enforcing unique file names. As a file administrator, you can enforce unique file names based on the file extension or folder location. You can enable files with specific extensions or files in specified folders to have duplicate file names. See [Enforce Unique File Names](GUID-B95F67C8-7843-4435-B632-4996A97FFEA5.htm) for more information.
* As a best practice, all CAD data should be added to a vault using the add-in client for the corresponding CAD application so as to retain and maintain file relationships. CAD data cannot be dragged and dropped into a vault or added through the vault client. By default, this practice is enforced. The Item data/BOM information should also be added by check-in via a native application and not via drag and drop. Turn off the Disable Check In of Design Files check box to allow CAD data to be added without using the corresponding add-in client. By doing so, file relationships will not be maintained.

  CAD data includes design files from the following applications:

  + AutoCAD and AutoCAD LT
  + Inventor
  + Revit
  + Navisworks
  + Civil 3D
  + AutoCAD Architecture
  + Map 3D
  + AutoCAD MEP
  + Microstation
  + Solidworks
  + Pro/E

### Working Folder and Inventor Projects

* Click Define to enforce a consistent working folder for all clients or allow clients to define their own working folder. You can also enforce a default Inventor project file for all clients or allow clients to use last Vault controlled project file.
* Duplicate Search Options
* Click Configure to specify folders to be included in the duplicate search range.

### PDF Options

* Select the settings for 2D AutoCAD, 2D Inventor, and 2D SolidWorks PDF publishing.
  + Click **Options...** to [configure PDF options](GUID-8EE12D8F-2381-4EE1-BAB0-D080F692500B.htm).
  + Click **Define...** to specify [PDF publish location](GUID-C0E7EBC3-3505-458F-A776-DF1F479FF49F.htm).

### DXF Options

* Select the settings for 2D AutoCAD, 2D Inventor DXF, or Flat Pattern DXF for publishing.
  + Click **Options...** to [configure DXF options](GUID-57BC9F5B-FBAC-4003-80BA-8C7A352DD503.htm).
  + Click **Define...** to specify [DXF publish location](GUID-5D7A9317-7428-49D9-90F0-59FC69D6C569.htm).

### STEP Options

* Select the settings for 3D Inventor STP publishing.
  + Click **Options...** to [configure STEP options](GUID-BE2CA612-EB3A-40BE-ACB3-DB530E5926D2.htm).
  + Click **Define...** to specify [STEP publish location](GUID-7D1947BD-8A06-4110-8115-5DE0506F803D.htm).

Note: The PDF, DXF, and STEP file publishing is only available in Vault Professional.

### Properties (Autodesk Vault Basic Only)

Note: Properties management for Autodesk Vault Professional is located on the Behaviors tab.

Click Properties to manage user-defined properties. All of the extracted properties being tracked by the vault can be managed using the Property Definitions dialog.

**Parent page:** [Access the Vault Settings Dialog](GUID-F507D651-0288-4AD3-94EF-3EA16503CECC.htm)

##### Behavior Administration Settings

# Behavior Administration Settings

The Behaviors tab on the Vault Settings dialog contains options for editing lifecycle definitions and managing revisions, administrating categories and rules, creating and modifying properties, defining customized numbering schemes, and assigning colors in reports.

Note: The Behaviors administration tab is available only in Vault Professional.

## Access the Behaviors tab on the Vault Settings Dialog

1. Click **Tools** > **Administration** > **Vault Settings**.
2. In the **Vault Settings** dialog, select the **Behaviors** tab.

### Lifecycles

Products have defined lifecycles from inception through production. You can edit and assign lifecycle definitions and configure state comments, security, and transitions on the Lifecycles Definitions dialog.

### Revisions

Revision schemes allow you to manage assign sequence values, formats, and comments to files and items that have been revised.

### Notifications

Configure email notification settings within vault to send notification for the specified lifecycle states transition, using the defined email template, and to the selected members.

### Categories

Category management provides a way to group properties logically and assign sets of behaviors and rules to one or more files or items.

### Rules

Rules allow you to automatically assign categories to files or items with particular properties.

### Properties

Click Properties to manage user-defined properties. All of the extracted properties being tracked by the vault can be managed using the Property Definitions dialog.

* Click Properties to display the Property Definitions dialog.

### Data Card

Click Data Card to configure the data card layout in Inventor, including the number of pages and the properties displayed on each page.

* Click Data Card to display the Configure Data Card dialog.

### Using Date Only While Updating Properties

Check Using Date Only While Updating Properties to exclude the time when updating Date properties. For example, if you map the Date File Created property to your title block, with this option checked the result could be **5/17/2017**, while with the option cleared the result would be **5/17/2017 11:11:10 PM**.

### Setting Boolean Property Type as Number

Check Set Boolean property type as number to write boolean value to file as 0/1 so that it can be converted back to boolean on server in a different locale.

### Automatic Numbering

Numbering schemes used in the Rename wizard can be defined using the Numbering Schemes dialog.

* Click Define to create and manage numbering schemes.

### Report Management

Color assignments for data mapping and reports are configured on the Assign Color dialog.

* Click Define to manage color assignments.

### Trash Bin

Enable the Trash Bin feature to move files or folders to Trash Bin instead of deleting directly when they are deleted.

* Select the **Enable Trash Bin** check box.

**Parent page:** [Access the Vault Settings Dialog](GUID-F507D651-0288-4AD3-94EF-3EA16503CECC.htm)


##### Item Administration Settings

# Item Administration Settings

Configure item behavior on the Items tab of the Vault Settings dialog.

Note: The Items feature is available only in Autodesk Vault Professional.

**Access the Items Tab on the Vault Settings Dialog**

1. Click **Tools > Administration > Vault Settings**.
2. In the Vault Settings dialog box, select the **Items** tab.

## Learn About the Items Tab

The Items tab on the Vault Settings dialog contains options for configuring units of measure, managing watermarking preferences, configuring settings for BOM rows, and enabling items to write back properties to associated files. You can also disable the items feature.

![](../images/vaultsettings-items.png)

## Item Enablement

Enable or disable the Items feature to better control user access.

* Click **Configure** to display the **Enable Items and Change Orders** dialog box.

## Units of Measurement

Define and edit units of measurement for items.

* Click **Configure** to display the **Units of Measure** dialog box and to modify the default settings.

## Watermarking

Item watermarks can automatically be generated based on an item's lifecycle state, a specified item property, or customized text. In addition, administrators can configure the watermark style and position.

* Select a Watermark source from the Watermarking drop-down.

  + **Lifecycle-based**

    The Watermark value is based on the current lifecycle state of the item.

    Note: By default, an out-of-the-box lifecycle called Item Release Process is used.

    To select a new lifecycle, make sure **Lifecycle-based** is selected in the drop-down menu and click **Configure**.
  + **Property-based**

    The Watermark value is based on a specific item property you have identified on the Property-based Watermark Settings dialog.

    Note: You are automatically prompted to identify an item property the first time you select this option.

    To select a new item property for the watermark value, make sure Property-based is selected in the drop-down menu and click **Configure**.
  + **Custom**

    The Watermark value comes from a value you enter on the Custom Watermark Settings dialog.

    Note: You are automatically prompted to identify a text value for the watermark the first time you select this option.

    To select a new custom value for the watermark, make sure **Custom** is selected in the drop-down menu and click **Configure**.
  + **None**

    No watermark is applied to items.

## Assign Item

Configure whether BOM rows are automatically turned on or not during item assignment.

* Click Configure to access the **Configure Assign Item** dialog.

## Property Write-Back

By default, item properties are written back to the associated file from Vault add-ins, Vault Explorer, and the Job Processor.

Item properties take precedence over file properties and file mappings. If the file's properties are edited and properties are synchronized, the item properties will overwrite the file properties.

Note: Item properties are also written to tertiary links as long as the file is a tertiary link to a single item.

* Clear the Write Item properties back to the file check box to disable item property write-back.

## Other

Determine whether or not a user is able to assign a category to an item when the item is created. By default, this option is selected.

* Clear the Allow user to assign category when creating a new item check box to disable this option.

**Parent page:** [Access the Vault Settings Dialog](GUID-F507D651-0288-4AD3-94EF-3EA16503CECC.htm)


##### Change Order Administration Settings

# Change Order Administration Settings

Configure change order behavior on the Change Orders tab of the Vault Settings dialog.

Note: The Change Orders feature is available only in Autodesk Vault Professional.

Access the Change Orders Tab on the Vault Settings Dialog

1. Click Tools > Administration > Vault Settings.
2. In the Vault Settings dialog box, select the **Change Orders** tab.

## Learn About the Change Orders Tab

The Change Orders tab contains options for restricting item changes to change orders depending on lifecycle or state, configuring the markup folder, managing change order link properties, and defining change order numbering schemes. You can also disable the Change Orders feature.

![](../images/vaultsettings-changeorders.png)

### Change Order Enablement

Disable or enable the Change Orders feature to better control user access.

* Click Configure to display the [Enable Items and change-orders](GUID-D7620D33-4FBF-40BB-A3D2-0A3C9A9F7BE5.htm) dialog box.

### Options

* **Restrict File and Item Lifecycle state changes to Change Orders –** Click [Configure](GUID-1DC7DCA0-EEC7-41AF-8AF6-59AD5AC10D27.htm) to specify whether lifecycle state changes are driven only by change orders.

  Note: You can also select whether to allow users with administrator permissions to override the restriction.
* **Restrict Change Orders from moving out of Work state based on File and Item Lifecycle states –** Click [Configure](GUID-FB5182CE-88E9-4A99-B6DC-72535916F16D.htm) to select which lifecycle states prevent a change-order from moving out of a work state.
